content:
くちいれやど〔口入宿〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: くちいれどころ〔口入所〕

content:
くちうつし〔口移し〕
〈名〉
1. (=口から口へ移すこと)transferring from mouth to mouth

content.content: 口移しに子どもを養う
to feed a child from mouth to mouth
口移しに気つけを飲ませた
I made him swallow a restorative from my mouth.

content: 2. (=口授)oral teaching; oral instruction

くちうら〔口占〕
〈名〉Gathering one's mind from one's words

content.content: 彼は事実を知らなそうな口占だった
I gathered from his words that he was ignorant of the facts of the case.
口占を引いてみる
to sound one's mind―feel one's pulse

content:
くちおしい〔口惜しい〕
〈主観的動詞〉To regret (the circumstance); to rue (the hour); to be vexed (at one's failure); to be mortified (at one's defect); to be chagrined (at the result, etc.)

content.content: 負けたのがいかにも口惜しい
I am vexed―mortified―chagrined―at my defeat.
口惜しそうな顔をして帰って来た
He returned with a rueful countenance.
口惜しや
Zounds!

content: 〈客観的形容詞〉Regrettable (circumstance); vexatious (failure); mortifying (defeat, etc.)

content.content: この口惜しい失敗の恥を雪がねはならぬ
I must wipe out the disgrace of this vexatious failure―this mortifying failure.

くちおしがる〔口惜しがる〕
〈自動〉To regret (the circumstance); to be vexed (at one's failure); to be mortified (at one's defeat); to be chagrined (at the result, etc.)

くちおも〔口重〕
〈形〉Slow of speech

くちがき〔口書き〕
〈名〉
1. (=口供)a deposition; an affidavit
2. (=口に筆をくわえて書くこと)writing or drawing with the brush in one's mouth

くちがしこい〔口賢い〕
〈形〉Quibbling; sophistical

content:
くちかず〔口数〕
〈名〉
1. (=人数)the number of persons
2. (=品数)the number of items; the number of shares
3. (=言葉数)the number of words uttered

content.content: 彼は口数が多い
He is talkative―loquacious―voluble.
口数の少ない人だ
He is a man of few words―a taciturn man.
口数をきかない
He is reticent―incommunicative.
彼は口数をきかない代りに要点を言う
He speaks dryly, but to the point.

content:
くちがたい〔口固い〕
〈形〉Discreet

content.content: 口固い男だから秘密を洩らす気遣いは無い
There is no fear of his disclosing the secret, for he is a discreet man.

content:
くちがる〔口軽〕
〈形〉
1. (=おしゃべり)talkative; voluble; loquacious

content.content: 彼は口軽だ
He is a glib talker.

content:
2. (=無考にしゃべりたがる)ready to talk on impulse
3. (=口に締りが無くて秘密が守れぬ)indiscreet; leaky

くちきき〔口利き〕
〈名〉A good speaker; a spokesman; a person of influence

content.content: あれは町内の口利きだ
He is the spokesman of the neighbourhood.
彼に口利きを頼もう
I will ask him to use his influence with the authorities.

content:
くちぎたない〔口汚い〕
〈形〉Foul (abuse); abusive, filthy, foul (language); foul-tongued, foul-spoken (man); scurrilous (reviler, etc.)

content.content: 口汚い悪口
foul abuses―scurrilous abuses
口汚い悪口を言う
to use foul language―use filthy language―use scurrilous language―fling dirt at a man
口汚く人を罵る
to revile a man
口汚い悪口を言う人だ
He is a foul-mouthed man―a foul-tongued man―a foul-spoken man―a scurrilous reviler.

content:
くちきり〔口切り〕
〈名〉Beginning; commencement:(殊に) broaching a subject

content.content: 口切りをする
to broach the subject―break the ice

content:
くちく〔駆逐〕
〈名〉Expulsion:(=する) to expel; to drive out; to clear (the mountains of bandits); to rid (one of enemies, etc.)

content.content: 敵を駆逐する
to clear the land of the enemy
海賊を駆逐する
to clear the sea of pirates
家の鼠族を駆逐する
to rid a house of vermin

content:
くちくかん〔駆逐艦〕
〈名〉A (torpedo-boat) destroyer

content.content: 駆逐艦隊
a destroyer flotilla

content:
くちくせ〔口癖〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: くちぐせ〔口癖〕

content:
くちぐせ〔口癖〕
〈名〉A way of saying (something); one's pet saying; one's cant

content.content: あの人は「そりゃそうさ」と言う口癖がある
He has a way of saying “There is no doubt about it.”
「忠君愛国」はあの人の口癖だ
“Patriotism and loyalty.” is his pet saying―his cant.
口癖のように言う
to harp on a subject
彼は口癖のようにそれを言っている
He is constantly harping on the same string.
時間の経済を口癖のように言っている
He is constantly harping on economy of time.
口癖のように人を賞める
to chant the praises of a man

content:
くちぐるま〔口車〕
〈名〉Cajolery; wheedling

content.content: 人を口車に乗せる
to cajole one―wheedle one
口車に乗る
to be cajoled―be wheedled
あの商人は口車に乗せて買わせる
He will cajole you into buying―wheedle you into buying―talk you into buying.
あの女は口車に乗せて金を取る
She will cajole you out of your money―wheedle you out of your money―talk you out of your money.
彼女は口車に乗せられて納得した
She was cajoled into compliance―wheedled into compliance―talked into compliance.

content:
くちごうしゃ〔口巧者〕
〈名〉A ready talker; a facile talker:(=な) facile-tongued

content.content: 彼は口巧者だ
He has a tongue in his head―the gift of the gab.

content:
くちごたえ〔口答〕
〈名〉A retort:(=する) to retort (on one); to answer back; to talk back

content.content: 主人にくちごたえするものじゃない
You should not talk back to your master.

content:
くちごもる〔口籠る〕
〈自動〉To mumble

content.content: 口ごもって言う
to mumble out something
彼は口ごもって返事をした
He mumbled out a reply.
その後は口ごもった
He mumbled out the rest.

くちごわい〔口強い〕
〈形〉Insistent (tone); obstinate (insistence); stubborn (argument, etc.)

content:
くちざ〔口座〕
〈名〉An account

content.content: 君はあの銀行に口座があるか
Have you an account with that bank?
銀行に口座を開く
to open an account with a bank
振替貯金口座番号
the number of transfer account

content:
くちさがない〔口性無い〕
〈形〉Sarcastic; satirical; censorious

content.content: 女は口さがない
Women like to pull their neighbours to pieces.
口さがない京童
the censorious world

content:
くちさき〔口先〕
〈名〉The mouth; the lips; professions:(=の) mouth-; lip-

content.content: 彼は口先がうまい
He is fair-spoken―smooth-tongued―He has a honeyed tongue.
口先ではうまいことを言う
He makes fine profession―His professions are very fine.
男の口先は当てにならぬ
Men's professions are not to be trusted―I do not believe a word of what men say.
彼は口先ばかりだ
He is all talk and no deed.
口先ばかり強い
“His bark is worse than his bite.”
江戸っ子は口先ばかり強い
The Edokko is a barking dog.
その名が口先まで出かかっていた
His name was on the tip of my tongue.
口先の尊敬
mouth-honour―lip-homage
口先の友人
a mouth-friend
口先の宗教
mouth-religion―lip-religion
口先の信者
a lip-Christian
口先のお勤め
lip-service

content:
くちざわり〔口触り〕
〈名〉Taste

content.content: この水は口触りが好い
His water is pleasant to the taste―pleasant to the palate―palatable.
洋酒は口触りが好いからつい知らず知らず飲んでしまう
Foreign wines are so pleasant to the taste that you are apt to overdrink yourself.

くちじゃみせん〔口三味線〕
〈名〉Vocal imitation of samisen music

くちじょうず〔口上手〕
〈名〉A good talker:(=な) facile-tongued

くちすい〔口吸い〕
〈名〉Kissing:(一回なら) a kiss:(=する) to kiss each other

content:
くちすぎ〔口過ぎ〕
〈名〉Livelihood; living; subsistence:(=する) to gain one's livelihood; to get one's living; to make a living; to live; to earn one's bread; to make the pot boil; to keep the pot boiling

content.content: 彼は口過ぎのために働くのだ
He works for a living―He works for his bread―He works to keep the pot boiling―He is a pot-boiler.
口過ぎのために筆を執るのだ
He writes for a living―writes for his subsistence.
彼は薄給でかながな口過ぎをしている
He starves on scanty pay.
口過ぎをするだけの収入が無い
He has not enough income to live on.
彼が働いて取る金でかながな一家の口過ぎをしている
He barely supports his family on his earnings.

くちずさむ〔口号む〕
〈他動〉
1. (=漫吟する)to hum (a song)
2. (=ふと心に浮かんだ詩歌を作る)to compose (a poem) impromptu

content:
くちだし〔口出し〕
〈名〉Interference:(=する) to interfere in, meddle in (anything); to poke one's nose into, thrust one's nose into (anything); to put in one's oar, shove in one's oar

content.content: 君はこのことに口出しをする権利が無い
You have no right to interfere in the matter.
彼は何でも彼でも口出しをしたがる
He will meddle in everything―He will poke his nose into everything―He has an oar in everybody's boat.
君が口出しするとかえって有害無益だ
Your interference will do more harm than good.
子どもが大人の話しに口出しするものじゃない
A child should listen in silence to the talk of the elders.

くちづから〔口づから〕
〈副〉From one's own lips

〈名〉
1. The mouth (as a feature)

content.content: あの娘は口つきが可愛らしい
She has a sweet mouth.

content: 2. (=紙巻タバコの口付き)a cigarette with a mouthpiece

くちづけ〔口付け〕
〈名〉Kissing:(一回なら) a kiss:(=する) to kiss (one)

〈名〉Tradition:(=する) to transmit (anything) orally

content:
ぐちっぽい〔愚痴っぽい〕
〈形〉Peevish; querulous

content.content: 愚痴っぽい老人だ
He is a peevish old man.
年を取ると愚痴っぽくなる
An old man will be querulous.

content:
くちどめ〔口止め〕
〈名〉Binding to secrecy:(=する) to bind (one) to secrecy; to swear (one) to secrecy; to stop one's mouth; to muzzle (one)

content.content: 金をくれて口止めした
I bribed him into secrecy―gave him hush-money.
口止め金
hush-money

〈名〉
1. (=馬丁)a groom
2. (=料理の口取り)an ornamental Japanese dish

content:
くちなおし〔口直し〕
〈名〉
1. Removing the after-taste:(=する) to get rid of the after-taste; to take the taste out of one's mouth

content.content: この薬はいやな味だから口直しに何か食わなければならぬ
The medicine has a nauseous taste, so you must eat something after to get rid of the after-taste―to take the taste out of your mouth.

content: 2. (=洋食の口直し)dessert

くちにする〔口にする〕
〈他動〉To taste; to say

content.content: 彼は酒を口にせぬ
He never tastes strong drink.
今日は何も口にせぬ
I have tasted no food today.
彼は始終忠君愛国を口にしている
He always has loyalty and patriotism on his lips.

She died with his name on her lips.

〈名〉A corkscrew

content.content: 口の端にかかる
to become the talk of people―be talked about by people
人の口の端にかかるようなことはせぬがよい
You ought not to do such things as will make you the talk of people―make people talk about you.

〈名〉Decayed leaves; dead leaves

くちばいろ〔朽葉色〕
〈名〉A reddish-yellow colour; russet

content:
くちばし〔嘴、喙〕
〈名〉A bill:(鷹や鷲などのは) a beak:(いずれも異名は) a neb

content.content: 彼はまだくちばしが黄色い
He is a chicken―a fledgling―a greenhorn.
くちばしを入れる
to interfere in a matter―meddle in anything―put in one's oar
きみはこのことにくちばしを入れる権利が無い
You have no right to interfere in the matter.
彼は何へでもくしばしを入れたがる
He will meddle in everything―He will poke his nose into everything―He has an oar in everybody's boat.

content:
くちばし〔嘴、喙〕
〈名〉A bill:(鷹や鷲などのは) a beak:(いずれも異名は) a neb

content.content: 彼はまだくちばしが黄色い
He is a chicken―a fledgling―a greenhorn.
くちばしを入れる
to interfere in a matter―meddle in anything―put in one's oar
きみはこのことにくちばしを入れる権利が無い
You have no right to interfere in the matter.
彼は何へでもくしばしを入れたがる
He will meddle in everything―He will poke his nose into everything―He has an oar in everybody's boat.

content:
くちばしる〔口走る〕
〈自動〉To blab; to babble a secret; to blurt out the truth; to let the cat out of the bag

content.content: うっかり口走ってしまった
I blurted out the truth in an unguarded moment.
あの男は口走るから秘密は聞かせられぬ
He is not to be trusted with secrets, for he will blab.

くちはてる〔朽ち果てる〕
〈自動〉To rot away; to end one's days

content.content: 田舎で朽ち果てる気は無い
I do not mean to end my days in the country.
なんぼ華族だからとて無為にして朽ち果てる必要は無い
A man, though born noble, need not rot away in inaction.

くちばみ〔蝮〕
〈名〉The viper; the adder

content:
くちばや〔口速〕
〈名〉A fast speaker

content.content: 口速にしゃべる
to speak fast
先生は口速で聞き取れぬ
He speaks so fast that I can not follow him.
口速にゴチャゴチャとしゃべる
to jabber

content:
くちび〔口火〕
〈名〉A fuse; a train

content.content: 口火を引く
to lay a train
口火をつける
to light the fuse―apply the match to the train

content:
くちひげ〔口髭〕
〈名〉A moustache

content.content: 彼は口髭を生やした
He has grown a moustache.
口髭を生やしている
He wears a moustache.
口髭をひねる
to twirl one's moustache

content:
くちびる〔唇〕
〈名〉The lip

content.content: 上唇
the upper lip
下唇
the lower lip―the under-lip
彼は唇が厚い
He has thick lips―He is thick-lipped.
唇が薄い
He has thin lips―He is thin-lipped.
唇の薄い者はおしゃべりだと言う
We say in Japan that thin-lipped people are talkative.
君は唇の色が好い
You have fresh lips.
(怒りや笑いを忍んで)唇を噛む
to bite one's lip
唇をとがらす
to make a lip―pout
唇を開いて眺めていた
She was looking with parted lips.
唇の乾かぬうちに自家撞着した
He contradicted himself in the same breath.
唇を返す
to abuse one―speak ill of one

Allies ruin themselves by deserting each other.

content:
くちぶえ〔口笛〕
〈名〉A whistle

content.content: 口笛を吹く
to whistle

くちふき〔口拭き〕
〈名〉A napkin:(給仕人が言えば) a serviette

くちぶちょうほう〔口不調法〕
〈名〉A poor talker

content:
くちぶり〔口振り〕
〈名〉
1. (=物の言いよう)one's way of talking

content.content: あの口ぶりでは何でも知っていそうだ
He talks as if he knew everything.

content: 2. (=口吻)a hint; an intimation

content.content: 不平らしい口ぶりだった
He hinted that he was dissatisfied―hinted at dissatisfaction.
辞職したいような口ぶりだった
He hinted that he would resign―hinted at resignation.
やってみたいような口ぶりだった
He intimated an inclination to try.

content:
くちべに〔口紅〕
〈名〉Rouge on the lip

content.content: 口紅をさす
to rouge the lip

content:
くちまえ〔口前〕
〈名〉One's manner of speaking

content.content: 彼は口前がうまい
He is fair-spoken.

content:
くちまかせ〔口任せ〕
〈名〉Random talk:(=に) at random

content.content: 口まかせにしゃべる
to talk at random
彼は口まかせに悪口を言う
He will call you every name he can lay his tongue to.

content:
くちまね〔口真似〕
〈名〉Mimicking one's manner of speaking:(=する) to mimic one's manner of speaking

content.content: 彼は口真似が上手だ
He mimics people to a tittle.

content:
くちまめ〔口まめ〕
〈形〉Talkative; loquacious; voluble; facile-tongued

content.content: 口まめな女だ
She is a talkative woman―a chatterbox.

content:
くちもと〔口元〕
〈名〉The mouth (as a feature)

content.content: 彼女は口元が可愛らしい
She has a sweet mouth.
鼻筋通って口元尋常
She has regular features.

content:
くちやかましい〔口喧しい〕
〈形〉Fault-finding; carping; captious; censorious; critical; hypercritical

content.content: 世間は口やかましい
The world is censorious―People will talk.
彼は口やかましく小言を言う
He finds fault with everything.
口やかましくとがめだてする人だ
He will carp at faults―cavil at faults―peck at flaws―He is a caviller―a captious man―a fault-finder.
口やかましい女だ
She is a shrew―a termagant.

content:
くちやくそく〔口約束〕
〈名〉A verbal promise; one's word:(=する) to make a verbal promise; to give one's word; to pass one's word; to pledge one's word

content.content: 彼の口約束は証文よりも確かだ
His word is as good as his bond.
あの人の口約束は当てにならぬ
He is not to be relied upon.

くちゃくちゃにする
〈他動〉To crumple, crumple up (a piece of paper)

content:
くちゅう〔苦衷〕
〈名〉Solicitous devotion (to some cause)

content.content: その勤王の苦衷察するに余りあり
His solicitous devotion to the cause of royalty commands our highest admiration.

くちゅうやく〔駆虫薬〕
〈名〉An insecticide; an insect-powder

content:
くちょう〔区長〕
〈名〉The headman of a ward

content.content: 神田区長
the headman of Kanda ward

content:
くちょう〔口調〕
〈名〉
1. (=語調)tone:(好い口調) euphony

content.content: この詩は口調が好い
The poem is euphonious―It has a good swing.
この言葉は口調が悪い
The expression lacks euphony―It does not sound well.
翻訳は原文の口調を存している
The translation retains the tone of the original.
彼は西洋人の口調をよく真似る
He catches the tone of foreigners.

content: 2. (=言いまわし)a turn of expression

content.content: これは新聞口調だ
This is a newspaper expression.

content:
ぐちょく〔愚直〕
〈形〉Simple and honest

content.content: あの人は愚直だけの取柄だ
He is nothing without his simple honesty―Honest simplicity is his only redeeming point.
彼は愚直をもって自任している
He calls himself simple and honest―He gives himself the character of honest simplicity.

content:
くちよごし〔口汚し〕
〈名〉
1. (=少しばかりのご馳走)A bit of food (serving only to stain the month)

content.content: ほんのお口汚しです
It is only a morsel.

content: 2. (=まずい物)unpalatable food

くちよせ〔口寄せ〕
〈名〉Invocation of a departed soul

content.content: 市子が口寄せをする
A medium invokes departed souls.

content:
くちる〔朽ちる〕
〈自動〉To decay; to rot

content.content: 木が朽ちている
The wood is decayed.
なんぼ華族だからとて無為にして朽ちてしまう必要は無い
A man, though born noble, need not rot away in inaction.
幾世までも名は朽ちぬ
His name shall live for ages―His name is immortal.
田舎で朽ちてしまう気は無い
I do not mean to end my days in the country.

content:
くちわ〔口輪〕
〈名〉A muzzle

content.content: 犬に口輪を掛ける
to muzzle a dog
犬は口輪が掛けてある
The dog is muzzled.
口輪を掛けた犬
a muzzled dog

くちわけ〔口分け〕
〈名〉Assortment:(=する) to assort (goods); to state the items

content:
くちわる〔口悪〕
〈名〉(事)a foul tongue:(人) a foul-tongued man

content.content: 彼は口悪だ
He has a foul tongue―He is foul-tongued.

ぐちんする〔具陳する〕
〈他動〉To state in detail; to lay (the case) before (one's chief, etc.)

content:
くつ〔靴、履〕
〈名〉
1. (英国にては深靴は)boots:(牛靴は)shoes:(米国にては深靴も牛靴も共に)shoes:(長靴)long boots; top-boots:(ゴム)elastic shoes; elastic boots:(編上げ靴)lace-shoes; lace-boots:(上靴)slippers:(雨靴)galoshes(は英国):(米国にては)overshoes; rubber-shoes

content.content: 靴をはく
(常になら)to wear shoes―(出かける時なら)―put on one's shoes.
あの女学生は靴をはいている
She is wearing shoes―She has shoes on―She is in shoes.
靴のほか昇校を許さず
No admittance except in shoes.
靴を脱ぐ
to take off one's shoes
靴を脱ぐことは無い、はいておれ
You need not take off your shoes. You may keep them on.
西洋人は家の中で靴をはいている
Foreigners wear their shoes―keep on their shoes―in the house.

a pair of shoes

to make shoes

靴をこしらえた(こしらえさした、新調した)

靴が縮まって足が痛い

content:
くつう〔苦痛〕
〈名〉Pain; agony; anguish; suffering

content.content: 苦痛を感ずる
I feel a pain.
苦痛にたえる
to bear pain
苦痛をやわらげる
to allay the pain―alleviate the pain―assuage the pain―mitigate the pain
苦痛を取って楽にする
to relieve (one of) pain
人に苦痛を与える
to inflict pain on one
快楽の価は苦痛なり
Pleasure is bought at the price of pain.
快楽と苦痛は蔭の光に伴うが如し
Pleasure and pain are inseparable like light and shade.
今の仕事はちと苦痛だ
My present work is a strain on my powers.
この税を払うのはまったく苦痛だ
This tax is a positive grievance to me.

to subvert the government

content:
くつがえる〔覆る〕
〈自動〉To upset; to overturn; to tip over; (a ship) capsizes, keels over; (a boat) turns turtle

content.content: 前車の覆るは後車の誠め
Take warning by another's failure―(親が子に向かって言えば)―Take example by your father, my boy!

究竟実力が勝つ
Real ability wins in the end―in the long run.

1. (=強壮)stalwart; sturdy; strapping

content.content: 屈竟な若者だ

content: 2. (=好個の)the best, the fittest, the most likely, the very (for some purpose)

content.content: 殖民地には屈竟な処だ
It is the likeliest place for a settlement―the very place for a settlement―just the place for a settlement.
この事業を起こすには今こそ屈竟な時期だ
Now is the best time―the most favourable time―for the enterprise.
彼は校長には屈竟な人物だ
He is the fittest person for a principal.
ここは防禦陣地には屈竟な場所だ

content: 3. (=手頃の)handy

content.content: 皆手に手に屈竟な得物を持っている

content.content: 屈辱を受ける
to be humiliated―suffer humiliation―be humbled in the dust

to humiliate one―humble one in the dust
屈辱を忍ぶ、屈辱に甘んずる
to submit to humiliation―eat humble-pie―eat dirt
日本人の性質としてそんな屈辱は忍べぬ
It is not in the Japanese to submit to such humiliation.

a disgraceful peace―a dishonourable peace
屈辱的敗北

content.content: グッサリ

content:

〈自他動〉
1. (=曲げる)to bend

content.content: 膝を屈する
to bend the knee
指を屈する
(日本では)to bend one's fingers―(西洋では)―count anything on one's fingers
こんな人は指を屈するだけしか無い
Such men may be counted on your fingers.
指を屈するにいとまあらず
They are too numerous to be counted―They are innumerable.
日本第一の学者として何人も彼に指を屈する
He is universally acknowledged as the greatest scholar in Japan.
身を屈する
to stoop to meanness―descend to baseness
彼は身を屈して人のご機嫌をとった
He stooped to flattery.
身を屈して人に物を乞うた
He stooped to beggary.

content: 2. (=挫ける)to be discouraged; to be disheartened; to be daunted

content.content: 彼は一度の失敗に屈するような男ではない
He is not the man to be a daunted by single failure.
少しも屈せず彼は再挙を計った
Nothing daunted, he prepared himself for another trial.
毫{ごう}も屈する色無く以前に倍する努力をもってかかった
Nothing daunted, he went at it with redoubled efforts.
彼は一度の失敗に屈して再挙の勇気が無かった
A single failure discouraged him from trying again.
些細な困難に屈していては何事も為せぬ
If you are disheartened by trifles, you will be unable to accomplish anything in the world.
彼は困難に屈せ猛進した
He pushed on in spite of the difficulties.
不幸に屈する
to sink under misfortune
不幸に逢っても屈せぬ
to bear up under misfortune―hold up under misfortune
気が屈する
to feel discouraged―feel disheartened

content: 3. (=屈服する)to submit (to authority); to yield (to persuasion); to give in (to one's antagonist)

content.content: 人に屈する
to submit to one
彼は容易なことで人の言うことに屈しない

content: 2. (=情を通ずる)to have a connection with each other; to have a liaison with each other

くっついている

そこまではどうやら言えたが、そこでグッと行き詰まった

これはあれよりグッと好い

腹が立つのをグッとこらえた

笑いたいのをグッとこらえた

泣きたいのをグッとこらえた

1. Tedious (talk); lengthy (speech); verbose (speech or speaker); wordy (style); diffuse (style or writer); prolix (writer or style); garrulous (old man); long-winded (speech); inquisitive (questioner); importunate (suitor, etc.)

content.content: 老人はくどい
Old men are garrulous.
老人はくどいものですよ

あの人の話しはくどい

あの人の演説はくどい

あの人の文章はくどい

(一度言えばわかるじゃないか)くどいね
Say no more!
あまりくどく聞くと彼は返事をしない

くどく聞くようだがその金は何に使うのですか
What do you want the money for, if I am not too inquisitive?
くどいようだがそのことは間違いありませんか

あまりくどくお願い申すようですがその金を今日中に間に合わして下さいませんか

あれは容易に口説き落とせる女じゃない
She is not to be easily won.
彼は手を換え品を換えてとうとう口説き落とした
By resorting to every conceivable means, he at last won her.

content:

〈名〉Merit; virtue; charity

content.content: 功徳を積む
to practise virtue―practise charity―do good―lead a virtuous life―run a godly race
功徳になる
to redound to one's merit―do good―do an act of charity
人を助ければ功徳になる
If you help others, you will do good―“He who gives to the poor lends to the Lord.”
功徳になるから助けておやり
Help him for charity's sake.
こんな本でも読んでやったら功徳になるだろう
If I read the book, I shall be doing the author an act of charity.
投票してやったら功徳になるだろう
It will be an act of charity to vote for him.
教えてやれ功徳になるから
Teach him for charity's sake―To teach him will be an act of charity―If you teach him, you will do an act of charity.
功徳の為
for charity's sake

content:
くどく〔口説く〕
〈他動〉(男をなら)to try to persuade (a man); to importune (one to do something); to solicit (one to do something):(女をなら)to woo, court, pay court to, make love to, make advances to, make improper overtures to (a woman); to besiege, lay siege to (a woman's heart)

content.content: 彼は女ばかり口説いている
He does nothing but make love to the girls.
こそこそ女を口説いている奴がある
Some fellows are courting on the sly.
彼は女将を口説きおったのだ
He has been making advances to―making improper overtures to―the landlady.
行ってみるとあいつ女を口説いているところだった
I found him kneeling at the feet of a girl.
口説いてふられたのだ
He has wooed her and been rejected.
男がしつこく口説く
He is importunate in his advances.
男にしつこく口説かれると風に柳と受け流している
She deftly eludes his importunities.
彼は女を口説くことが上手だ(下手だ)
He knows his way to a woman's heart―does not know his way to a woman's heart.
人を口説く秘訣を知っている
He knows how to find his way to a man's heart.
人を口説くには三寸の舌の先
“The ear is the way to the heart.”
彼は口説き上手だ
He is persuasive―seductive.→『くどきおとす〔口説き落とす〕』

〈名〉
1. (=国土)a country:(詩歌にては)a land:(帝国)an empire:(王国)a kingdom:(共和国)a republic

content.content: 日の本の国
the Land of the Rising Sun
日の入らぬ国
the Empire on which the sun never sets
日本ほど好い国はない
Japan is the best country under the sun―the best land the sun shines upon.
国を開く

国を統一する

そんな事があったら国がぐらつく

家には鼠、国には盗人

content.content: 国を愛す

日本人は誰でも国を愛する
Every Japanese loves his country―Japan is dear to every Japanese heart―The Japanese are a patriotic people.
国の為に命を捨てる
to lay down one's life for one's country―give one's life for one's country―die for one's country
国の為に尽くす
to serve the State―render service to one's country
国の為に働く

国を思う

あの人はお国自慢だ
He is proud of his country―He takes pride in his country.
国を売る
to sell one's country―betray one's country
農は国の基なり
Agriculture is the foundation of the state.
あのような人は国の宝だ
Such men are the nation's boast.

content.content: あなたはお国は

僕の国は仙台です
I come from Sendai―I hail from Sendai―I am from Sendai.
国を出る
to leave home
僕は十五の年に国を出た
I left home at the age of fifteen.
国へ帰る
to go home
試験をすまして国へ帰ります
I am going home when the examination is over.
お国からお便りがありましたか
Have you heard from home?
お国へお便りをなさいますか
Do you white home?
国から来た人に向かってお国の方ではお変わりはありませんか
How did you leave your people at home?

content: 7. (=国籍)nationality

1. (=分配する)to distribute (presents); to deal (cards); to deal out (rice); to serve out (rations); to measure out (food to the poor); to mete out (reward or punishment); to dole out (alms sparingly); to help (one to anything at table)

content.content: 引札を配る

気を配る、心を配る

content:

〈名〉
1. The head

content.content: 首を振る
to shake one's head
首を縦に振る
to nod assent
亀が首を引込ませる
A tortoise draws in its head.
恥じて首を垂れる
to hang one's head for shame
首を垂れて歩いて来た
He came walking with bowed head.
首をひねる
to put one's head on one side
首をひねって思案していた
He was thinking with his head on one side.
これを見れば誰でも首をひねる
If any one sees this, he will fall to thinking―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The sight will set any one thinking.
泳ぐことはできないがどうかこうか首だけ出しておった
I could not swim, but I managed to keep myself above water.
敵の首を取る
to take the enemy's head
鬼の首でも取ったように(に相当するは)
as if he had killed a giant
鬼の首でも取ったつもり(に相当するは)
He has found a mare's nest.
首実検する
to identify a head
首実検
the identification of a head
首を斬る、首をはねる
to cut off one's head―behead one―decapitate one
彼は首を斬られた
He had his head cut off―He was beheaded.
首を獄門にさらす
to gibbet a head
首に係かる問題だ
It is a hanging matter.
そんなことをすると首が無いぞ
If you do such a thing, you will lose your head―Such conduct will cost you your head―It is as much as your head is worth to do such a thing.
間違ったら首をやる(首に懸けて保証する)
I will answer for it with my head―answer for it with my life.
暫く首を預けておく
I will leave your head in your charge―leave your head on your shoulders―for a while.
首に懸賞する

彼の首には千円の懸賞がついている
A price of 1,000 yen is set on his head.
首に懸賞つきのお尋ね者だ
He is a fugitive with a price on his head.
彼は借金で首がまわらぬ
He is over head and ears in debt―up to the ears in debt―deeply in debt.
男が女に首ったけ惚れている
He is over head and ears in love―deeply in love―with her.
雇人を首にする

彼は首にされた、首になった

頸輪

犬の頸輪

足頸(足首)

徳利の頸

1. (=分かつこと)division; section; demarcation:(=する) to divide; to section; to demarcate; to draw a line of demarcation

content:
くべつ〔区別〕
〈名〉
1. (=差別)distinction:(=する) to distinguish (between two things―one thing from another); to make a distinction (between two things); to know (one from the other); can tell (one from the other); to draw the line (between two things)

content.content: 正邪を区別する
to distinguish between right and wrong―distinguish right from wrong
君は真の友人と偽の友人の区別を知らない
You don't know a true friend from a false one―You can't tell a true friend from a false one.
彼は敵味方の区別をも知らぬ

彼は誰彼の区別をせぬ

誰彼の区別無く人を取扱う

老若男女の区別無く皆入会を許す
Everybody is admitted, without distinction of age or sex.
朝鮮人は日本人と区別ができない
A Korean is not to be distinguished from a Japanese―indistinguishable from a Japanese.

The sky suddenly became covered with clouds.

cloudy weather―dull weather

a cloudy day―a dull day

content: 3. (=鏡などが曇る)to dim; to become dim; to be blurred

content.content: 鏡が雲っている

content: 4. (=液体が曇る)to become cloudy; to turn milky

content:

苦悶のあまり発声した
I cried out in anguish.

くやくしょ〔区役所〕
〈名〉A ward office

content:
くやしい〔悔しい〕
〈主観的動詞〉To be vexed (at one's failure); to be chagrined (at one's defeat); to be mortified (at unexpected failure); to be angry (with one for doing something); to regret (a circumstance); to rue (the day, the hour when it happened)

content.content: 落第して悔しい
I am vexed at my failure―(他動詞構文にすれば)―My failure vexes me.
負けて悔しくないか
Are you not chagrined―mortified―at your defeat?
彼は落選してさぞ悔しかったろう
He must have been mortified at his defeat in the election.
貞操を蹂躙されて悔しい
I am angry with him for dishonouring me.
僕は学校を半途にして止めたのが悔しい
I rue the day when I left school half-way.
僕は学力のたらないのが悔しい
I regret my want of ability.
悔しくて黙っていられなかった
I could not contain myself for very vexation.
彼は悔しそうな顔をして帰ってきた
He returned with a rueful countenance.
彼は悔しそうに歯を喰いしばって死んでおった
He was found dead with his teeth set as if in vexation of heart.
悔しかったら力で来い
If you are angry with me, try your strength against mine.

content: 〈客観的形容詞〉Vexing (failure); mortifying (defeat); regrettable (circumstance)

content.content: 彼は負けて悔しいだろう
(主観的に言えば)He must be mortified at his defeat―(客観的に言えば)―His defeat must be mortifying to him.
実に悔しい
How vexing!―How mortifying!
明けて悔しき玉手箱
I found the casket empty―found the bird flown―found it an apple of Sodom.

content:
くやしがり〔悔しがり〕
〈名〉One who takes a failure or a defeat to heart

content.content: あの相撲は悔しがりだ
He takes his defeat awfully to heart.

content:
くやしがる〔悔しがる〕
〈自動〉To be vexed (at one's failure); to be chagrined (at one's defeat); to be mortified (at unexpected failure); to rue (the day, the hour when it happened); to regret (a circumstance); to resent (an insult); to brood over (one's wrongs)

content.content: 彼は失敗して悔しがっている
He is vexed at his failure―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His failure vexes him.
悔しがって発狂でもするかと思った
He nearly went mad with vexation―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Vexation nearly drove him mad.
あれほど苦心した作がうまくいかないのを悔しがるのも無理は無い
It is quite natural that he should feel mortified―feel chagrined―at the failure of a work which cost him so much labour.
彼は学校を半途にして止めたことを今悔しがっている
He now rues the day when he left school half-way.
学力の足らないことを悔しがっている
He regrets his want of ability.
歯ぎしりして悔しがった
He ground his teeth with vexation.
彼は受けもせぬ仇を受けたつもりで悔しがっている
He broods over fancied wrongs.

content:
くやしくも〔悔しくも〕
〈副〉(動詞に訳して)can not pretend (to something or to do something); to have no pretension (to something)

content.content: 彼は悔しくも学者などとは言えぬ
He can not pretend to learning―He has no pretension to learning.
彼女は悔しくも美人だなどと言えた柄じゃない
She can not pretend to beauty―She has no pretension to beauty.
彼は悔しくもそんなぜいたくはできない
He can not pretend to indulge in such luxuries.

content:
くやしさ〔悔しさ〕
〈名〉Vexation; chagrin; mortification

content.content: 彼は失敗して悔しさのあまりこんな早まったことをしたのだろう
He must have committed the rash act in his vexation at his failure.
事失敗と聞く悔しさ
I heard, to my vexation, that the thing was failure.
あまりの悔しさにわっと泣き出した
I burst into a flood of tears in vexation of spirit.
かなわぬ恋の悔しさに相手の女を締め殺した
He strangled the woman in the frenzy of disappointed live.

content:
くやしまぎれに〔悔し紛れに〕
〈副〉Out of vexation; out of chagrin; out of mortification

content.content: 彼は悔し紛れにこんな早まったことをしたのだろう
He must have committed the rash act out of sheer vexation.

くやむ〔悔む〕
〈他動〉

content.content: 僕は若い時勉強しなかったのを悔んでいる
I am sorry I was idle in my youth―I repent of my past idleness.
彼は悪いことをして悔んでいる
He is sorry for what he has done―He regrets having done wrong.
前非を悔む
to repent of the past
罪を悔む
to repent of one's sins
彼女は罪を犯して悔んでいる
She is penitent for her sin―a penitent sinner.
罪を犯しても悔みさえすれば天はこれを赦し給う
Heaven will pardon a contrite heart.
僕は学校を半途で止めたのを今悔んでいる
I now rue the day when I left school half-way.
いまさら悔んでも詮無きことだ
Regrets will not mend matters.
悔んでも帰らぬことをくよくよする(死んだ子の年を数える)のは愚である
It is foolish to indulge in vain regrets―to cry over spilt milk.
ほぞを喰んで悔む
to repent bitterly

content:
2. (=悔みを言う)to condole with (one) on one's affliction

content:
くよくよする〔クヨクヨする〕
〈自動〉To worry (oneself)

content.content: クヨクヨするな
Don't worry!―Cheer up!―Never say die!
君はつまらぬことにあまりクヨクヨし過ぎる
You worry too much over trifles.
あまりクヨクヨすると病気になるぞ
You will worry yourself ill.
彼はあまりクヨクヨして肺病になった
He has worried himself into consumption.
悔いて帰らぬことをクヨクヨするな
Do not indulge in vain regrets―Do not cry over spilt milk―“It is no use crying over spilt milk.”
何をクヨクヨ
Why worriest thou so,
河端柳
O Willow by the Brook?―
水の流れを
The tide is high or low,
見て暮らす
And glad or sad I look.

content:

〈自動〉To worry (oneself)

Don't worry!―Cheer up!―Never say die!
君はつまらぬことにあまりクヨクヨし過ぎる
You worry too much over trifles.
あまりクヨクヨすると病気になるぞ
You will worry yourself ill.

He has worried himself into consumption.
悔いて帰らぬことをクヨクヨするな
Do not indulge in vain regrets―Do not cry over spilt milk―“It is no use crying over spilt milk.”
何をクヨクヨ

見て暮らす

content:

〈名〉A saddle

content.content: 馬に鞍を置く
to saddle a horse
馬には鞍が置いてある

馬の鞍を下ろす
to unsaddle a horse

〈名〉
1. A godown; a warehouse; a storehouse

content.content: 品物を倉に入れる

倉に納める

倉入れ

倉を開ける

倉を開けて下さるわけにはいくまいか

to build a godown

storage

content: 3. (=武庫)a magazine; an armoury

くらい〔暗い〕
〈形〉
1. (=暗黒)dark (night); gloomy (day); dim (light); sombre (sky); dusky (cellar); murky (recesses, etc.)

content.content: 暗い晩だ
The night is dark.
暗い日だ
It is a gloomy day.
ランプが暗い
The lamp is dim―not bright.
ランプを暗くする
to turn down the lamp
電灯が暗くなった
The electric light has grown dim.
暗くなる
It grows dark―Darkness sets in―darkness closes.
暗くなるから帰ろう
Let us go home, for it is getting dark.
暗くならないうちに帰ろう
Let us go home before it is dark.
暗くなってから家へ行き着いた
I got home after dark.
暗いうちに(夜明け前に)立った
I started before daylight―before daybreak.
暗い所
a dark place―a prison
暗い所へ入れられる
to be put in prison
幕を掛けて室内を暗くする
to shade a room with curtains
樹木生い茂りて昼なお暗し
The luxuriant foliage of the trees makes a twilight of noon-day―The noon-day sun can not penetrate the luxuriant foliage of the trees.

content: 2. (=不案内)ignorant (of the fact); unversed (in anything)

content.content: 僕は事情に暗い
I am ignorant of the circumstances.
彼は世事に暗い
He is ignorant of the world.
時事に暗い、時世に暗い
He is out of touch with the times.
僕はこの辺の地理に暗い
I am not acquainted with the neighbourhood―I am a stranger in these parts.
彼は歴史に暗い
He is unversed in history.
その道に暗からず
He is versed in the art―skilled in the art.

content: 3. (=後暗い)dark (side); shady (transactions); underhand (tricks, etc.)

content.content: 彼の身には暗い処がある
There are dark spots in his life―There is a dark side to his life.
僕は身に暗い処が無いから誰の前をも憚らぬ
I am not afraid of any one, for I am conscious of having done right.
彼は暗い取引に関係している
He is mixed up in shady transactions.
彼の行為には暗い処は無い
There is nothing underhand in his conduct―He does everything above-board.

content:
くらい〔位〕
〈名〉
1. (=位階)rank; grade

content.content: 位のある人
a man of rank
甲は乙より位が上、乙は甲より位が下だ
A is above B in rank―B is below A in rank.
位が上がる、位が下がる
to rise in rank―fall in rand
位を上げる
to raise one in rank―promote one in rank
位を下げる
to lower one in rank―degrade one
特旨をもって位一級進めらる
He was promoted in court rank by one degree as a special act of grace.
位を贈る
to confer a posthumous rank on a person
位を贈られる
to be posthumously promoted in court rank
齢人寿を全うし位人臣を極む
He died full of years and honours.
公卿の位倒れ
The court nobles could not live up to their ranks.
位負けがする
to be unworthy of one's rank

content: 2. (=帝王の位)the throne

content.content: 位に登る
to ascend the Throne―mount the Throne
位に即く
to accede to the Throne
位を嗣ぐ
to succeed to the Throne
位に座す
to sit on the Throne
位を辞す
to abdicate the Throne
位を譲る
to abdicate the Throne in favour of the Prince Imperial
位を争う
to lay claim to the Throne―pretend to the Throne

content: 3. (=品位)dignity; nobility

content.content: 人に位がつく
A man gains in dignity.
学問をすると人に位がつく
Learning ennobles a man.

content: 4. (=位置)situation; location:(=する) to be situated, be located (in some quarter)

content.content: 皇居は市の中央に位す
The Imperial Palace is situated in the heart of the city.
航海国としての日本は世界第三位に位す
Japan, as a maritime power, takes the third place in the world.
英国は第一位に位する
England takes the first place.
このくらい、これくらい
this much―thus much―so much
高さはこれくらいある
It is (about) as high as this.
あのくらい、あれくらい、そのくらい、それくらい
that much―so much
それくらいのこと
a thing like that―such a trifle
それくらいのことなら僕にもできる
I could do a thing like that.
それくらいのことで怒るものでない
You should not get angry at such trifles.
どのくらい
(量なら)how much?―(数なら)―how many?
どのくらい借金があるか
How much do you owe?―What do you owe?―What is the extent of your liabilities?
金がどのくらいかかるか
How much does it cost?―What does it cost?
どのくらい時間がかかるか
How long does it take?
里程はどのくらいあるか
How far is it?―What is the distance?
高さはどのくらいあるか
How high is it?―What is the height?
長さはどのくらいあるか
How long is it?―What is the length?
幅はどのくらいあるか
How broad is it?―What is the breadth?
深さはどのくらいあるか
How deep is it?―What is the depth?
厚さはどのくらいあるか
How thick is it?―What is the thickness?
値はどのくらいか
What is the price?―how much?
お前のためにどのくらい心配したか知れやしない
You do not know what anxiety you caused me.

content: 2. (=殆ど)about; almost; some; something like; not more than; or so; or thereabouts; more or less

content.content: 彼の財産は五十万くらいのものだろう
He must be worth about 500,000―some 500,000―something like 500,000―500,000, more or less.
あれは泥棒くらいはしかねない奴だ
He is quite capable of robbery, more or less.
あの学校は生徒が四五百くらいのものだ
The school has not more than four or five hundred students.
道は一マイルくらいのものだ
The distance is only a mile or so.
三マイルくらいのものだ
It is three miles or thereabouts.
三マイルも無いくらいだ
It is scarcely three miles.
彼はどこでも行かないところは無いくらいだ
He has been almost everywhere.［注意］「無いくらい」は次のように訳す。
金なんか要らないくらいだ
You want next to no money―scarcely any money.
得るところは無いと言ってもよいくらいだ
I gained next to nothing―scarcely anything.
それは不可能と言ってよいくらいだ
It is next to impossible―hardly possible.［注意］「同じくらい」は次のように訳す。
同じくらい
much the same
生徒数は去年も今年も同じくらいだ
The number of students is much the same this year as last.
皆同じくらいの年輩だ
They are much of an age.
彼は君と同じくらいの年輩だ
He is about your own age.
皆同じくらいの背格好だ
They are much of a size.
彼は君と同じくらいの背格好だ
He is about your own size.

content: 3. (=少なくとも)at least

content.content: 暇乞いくらいに来てもよさそうなものだ

せめて百円くらいは出してもよさそうもものだ

君は日本外史くらいは読めるだろう
You can, at least, read “the Nihon Gaishi.”

content: 4. (=雪くらい白いの位)as... as...

content.content: 髪は鳥くらい黒い
His hair is as black as a raven.
兄弟は瓜を二つに割ったくらい似ている
The brothers are as like as two peas.
日本人であのくらい英語を話す人がいくらもある
Many Japanese speak English as well as he.
高さはこれくらいある
It is as high as this―about as high as this.

content: 5. (=雪くらい白いものは無いの位)(Nothing is) so... as..., more... than...

content.content: 雪くらい白いものは無い
Nothing is so white as snow―Nothing is whiter than snow.
日本人であれくらい英文を書く人は少ない
Few Japanese write English so well as he.
試験は思ったくらいむつかしくなかった
The examination was not so difficult as I had expected.
春くらい好い季節は無い
No season is so pleasant as spring―No season is pleasanter than spring―Spring is the pleasantest season of the year.
鳥の毛くらい軽いものはない
Nothing is so light as feather―Nothing is lighter than feather.
金剛石くらい堅いものは無い
Nothing is so hard as diamonds―Nothing is harder than diamonds―Nothing surpasses diamonds in hardness―Diamonds are the hardest substance.
これくらい造作無いことは無い
Nothing is easier―Nothing can be simpler.
日本くらい好い国は無い
There is no country better than Japan―Japan is the best country under the sun.

content: 6. (=泣きたいくらい悲しいの位)so... that...; so... as to...; enough to...:(打消に伴えば)too... to...

content.content: 嬉し泣きに泣きたいくらい嬉しかった
I was so glad that I could have cried for joy.
疲れるくらい歩いた
I have walked so much that I am tired―I have walked so much as to get tired―I have walked enough to tire me.
酒を飲むのはよいが酔うくらい飲んではいけない
You may drink, but not so much as to make you drunk.
時計が止まるくらいの地震であった
The shock was so severe that the clocks stopped―so severe as to stop the clocks―severe enough to stop the clocks.
一番汽車に間に合うくらいに早く起きた
I got up so early that I was in time for the first train―so early as to be in time for the first train―early enough to be in time for the first train.

content: 7. (=何々しきれないくらいの位)more... than...

content.content: あの人は使いきれないくらい金がある
He has more money than he can spend.
読みきれないくらい本を貰った
I have received more books than I can read.
うちの鶏は食い切れないくらい卵を生む
Our hens lay more eggs than we can eat.

content: 8. (=何々と言っても好いくらい)one might almost say; not to say

content.content: 彼は非常な倹約で吝嗇と言ってもよいくらいだ
He is so frugal that you might call him stingy―He is very frugal, one might almost say stingy―He is very frugal, not to say stingy.
彼は乞食と言ってもよいくらいだ
You might call him a beggar―He is little better than a beggar.
彼は死んだと言ってもよいくらいだ
You might call him a dead man―He is all but dead―He is as good as dead.

content: 9. (=何々くらいするならの位)at all

content.content: どうせ行くくらいなら早く行け
If you go at all, go early―If you do go, go early.
金を出すくらいならたくさん出せ
If you give at all, give much―If you do give, come down handsomely.
戦争は善い事ではないがやるくらいならあくまでやれ
War is an evil; but if you fight at all, fight it out―if you do fight, fight it out.

content: 10. (=何々する位ならいっその位)rather... than...; better... than...

content.content: 降参するくらいならいっそ死ぬ
I would rather die than surrender―I would sooner die than surrender―I would as soon die as surrender.
半途にして止すくらいならいっそ始めから手をつけぬ方がよい
You had better leave a thing undone than leave it half-done.
物事を半途に知るくらいならいっそ知らぬ方がよい
One may as well know nothing as know things by halves.

content: 11. (=君位のものだの位)perhaps the only; about the only

content.content: あの難物を使いこなせるのは君くらいのものだろう
You are perhaps the only man that can manage that troublesome character.
外敵襲来の憂いが絶対に無い国は日本くらいのものだろう
Japan is perhaps the only country that is absolutely secure from foreign invasion.
あの人のできるのは語学くらいのものだろう
Languages are almost the only things that he knows.

content:
12.

content.content: 言うに言われぬくらい嬉しかった
I was unspeakably glad.
行きくらいは歩けるだろう
You can walk there, if not back.

〈接尾詞〉About; as (much) as; (not) so (much) as; (not) more than; not more than

content.content: 彼は百万ぐらいはあるだろう
He must be worth about a million―some million.
あれぐらいの金持ちはいくらもある
There are any number of men as rich as he is.
でもあれぐらい金儲けの上手な人はたんと無い
But there are few men who are so good at money-making as he is.
あのぐらい慾張る人を見たことが無い
I never saw a man more grasping than he is.
(生徒の数は)五六百ぐらいのものだ
Not more than five or six hundred.
特別に研究を要するのは英語と数学ぐらいのものだ
English and mathematics are about the only things that require special study.
そんなことを言うのは君ぐらいのものだ
You are perhaps the only man who says so.
いや間違いぐらいではすむまい
The plea of a mistake can not excuse your conduct.

Does man live to eat or eat to live?―live that he may eat or eat that he may live?
彼は酒ばかり食っている
He does nothing but drink.
坐して食えば山も空し
Idleness will consume a mountain of wealth.

content.content: 悟り開けば苦楽も無くなる
A philosopher is indifferent to pleasure or pain.
苦楽を共にする
to share one's joys and sorrows with one―share one's fortunes with one
妻は夫と苦楽を共にする
A wife should participate in the joys and sorrows of her husband.
苦楽を共にした妻は捨てられぬ
I can not discard a wife who has shared my fortunes with me.

content:
くらし〔暮らし〕
〈名〉
1. (=生活)life; living; livelihood; subsistence; existence

content.content: 暮らしを立てる
to live―subsist―get along―get one's living―make a living―gain one's livelihood―earn one's bread―make the pot boil―keep the pot boiling
彼はどうして暮らしを立てているか
How does he live?―How does he get his living?―How does he gain his livelihood?―How does he earn his bread?
商売をして暮らしを立てている
He lives by his trade.
筆で暮らしを立てている
He lives by the pen―He writes for a living.
女は洗濯をして暮らしを立てている
She lives by washing―She washes for a living.
どうかこうか暮らしを立てている
He manages to live―rubs along somehow.
立派に暮らしを立てている
He makes a good living.
かながな暮らしを立てている
He makes a bare living.
かなりな暮らしをしている
He makes a pretty good living―cracks a tidy crust.
未亡人は針仕事をしてささやかな暮らしを立てている
The widow picks up a scanty livelihood by needlework.
いくらあったら暮らしが立つか
What can you live on?―What can you subsist on?―What can you get along on?
月百円あったら暮らしが立つ
I can live on 100 yen a month.
家族が五人もあっては月百円では暮らしが立たぬ
A family of five can not live on―subsist on―100 yen a month.
君は暮らしを立てるだけ取れるか
Can you get enough to live on?
この辺の商人は夏期中に一年間の暮らしを立てるだけ儲ける
The tradesmen of these parts earn during the summer months enough to live on for a whole year.
暮らしにいくらかかるか
What does living cost?
一人の暮らしに月五十円はかかる
A man's living costs 50 yen a month.
暮らしのかかり
the cost of living
米価の騰貴は暮らしに響く
The appreciation of rice affects the cost of living.
安楽な暮らし
an easy life―a comfortable life
安楽な暮らしをする
to lead an easy life―live a life of ease―(何不自由無くなら)―live at one's ease―(衣食に不自由無くなら)―live in comfort
彼は隠居して安楽な暮らしだ
He has retired from active life, and lives at his ease.
独身者は月百円あれば安楽な暮らしができる
A bachelor can live in comfort on 100 yen a month.
ぜいたくな暮らし
a luxurious life―high living
ぜいたくな暮らしをする
to live high―live in luxury―live in clover
上等な暮らしをする
to live in style
倹約な暮らし
a frugal life
倹約な暮らしをする
to lead a frugal life―live on sixpence a day
彼は非職給で倹約な暮らしをしている
He economizes on his half-pay.
裕福な暮らしをする
to live in opulence
身分相応の暮らしをする
to live within one's means―conform oneself to one's fortunes―“cut one's coat according to one's cloth”
身分不相応の暮らしをする
to live above one's means
その日暮らしをする
to live from hand to mouth
その日暮らし
a hand-to-mouth existence

content: 3. (=暮らし向き)circumstances

content.content: 彼は暮らしはどうか
How are his circumstances?
暮らしは楽だ、暮らしが好い
He is in easy circumstances―well off.
暮らしが悪い、暮らしに困って要る
He is in straitened circumstances―in narrow circumstances―badly off.
暮らしは豊かだ
He is in affluent circumstances―very well off.

content:
くらしかた〔暮らし方〕
〈名〉A style of living

content.content: 彼はどんな暮らし方をしているか
What is his style of living?
上等な暮らし方だ
He lives in style.

くらしき〔鞍敷〕
〈名〉A saddle-cloth; a panel

くらしき〔倉敷〕
〈名〉Storage:(倉敷料) storage charge; warehouse rent

くらした〔鞍下〕
〈名〉(=鞍下肉)Sirloin (of beef)

content:
くらしむき〔暮らし向き〕
〈名〉Circumstances

content.content: 彼は暮らし向きはどうか
How are his circumstances?
暮らし向きは楽だ
He is in easy circumstances―well off.
暮らし向きは困難だ
He is in straitened circumstances―in narrow circumstances―badly off.
暮らし向きは豊かだ
He is in affluent circumstances―very well off.
暮らし向きは贅沢だ
He lives in luxury―lives in clover.
何不自由無い暮らし向きだ
He lives at his ease.
下女下男を大勢使って大した暮らし向きだ
He keeps a large establishment.

content:
くらす〔暮らす〕
〈自動〉(=生活する)to live (on so much); to get along (on so much); to subsist (on charity); to get one's living; to make a (good or poor) living; to gain one's livelihood; to earn one's bread; to make the pot boil; to keep the pot boiling

content.content: 彼はどうして暮らしているか
How does he live?―How does he get his living?―How does he gain his livelihood?―How does he earn his bread?
月給で暮らしている
He lives on his salary.
彼は商売をして暮らしている
He lives by his trade.
英語を教えて暮らしている
He lives by teaching English.
筆で暮らしている
He lives by the pen―He writers for a living.
女は洗濯をして暮らしている
She lives by washing―She washes for a living.
彼はどうかこうか暮らしている
He manages to live―gets along somehow―rubs along somehow―scratches along somehow.
どうかこうか暮らして行けりゃ結構だ
We must be content if we can get along anyhow.
彼は暮らすに困難だろう
He must find it hard to get along.
彼は立派に暮らしている
He makes a good living.
かなりに暮らしている
He makes a pretty good living―cracks a tidy crust.
かながな暮らしている
He makes a bare living.
彼は人並みに暮らせるようになった
He can now make a decent living.
未亡人は針仕事をしてささやかに暮らしている
The widow picks up a scanty livelihood by needlework.
安楽に暮らす
(何不自由無くなら)to live at one's ease―(衣食に不自由無くなら)―live in comfort
彼は隠居して安楽に暮らしている
He has retired from active life, and lives at his ease.
独身者は月百円あれば安楽に暮らせる
A bachelor can live in comfort on 100 yen a month.
(彼は工面が好いから)安楽に暮らしている
He is in easy circumstances.
豊かに暮らす
to live in affluence―live in clover
贅沢に暮らす
to live high―live in clover
左団扇で暮らす
to live in ease and luxury―live in clover
娘に嫁がせて親達は左団扇で暮らしている
While their daughter lives a life of shame, the parents live in clover―They batten on their daughter's shame.
派手に暮らす
to live in style
倹約に暮らす
to live frugally―live on sixpence a day
彼は非職給で倹約に暮らしている
He economizes on his half-pay.
質素に暮らす、こぢんまり暮らす
to live in a small way
身分相応に暮らす
to live within one's means―conform oneself to one's fortunes―“cut one's coat according to one's cloth”
身分不相応に暮らす
to live above one's means
いくらあったら暮らせるか、暮らすのにいくらかかるか
What can one live on?―What does living cost?
月百円あったら暮らしていける
One can live on 100 yen a month.
家族が五人もあっては月百円でくらしていけない
A family of five can not live on―subsist on―100 yen a month.
彼はあればかりの給料でどうして暮らしていけるかしら
I wonder how he can live on―subsist on―get along on―such scanty pay.
彼は女房に稼がせて暮らしている
He lives on his wife's earnings.
君は暮らして行くだけ取れるか
Can you get enough to live on?
この辺の商人は夏期中に儲けたので一年中暮らしている
The tradesmen of these parts earn during the summer months enough to live on for a whole year.

content:
〈自他動〉
1. (=一生を暮らす)to lead a life; to live a life

content.content: 一生楽に暮らす
to lead an easy life―live a life of ease
一生遊んで暮らす
to lead an idle life―live a gay life
一生を夢に暮らす
to dream one's life away
一生寝て暮らす
to sleep one's life away
碌々として暮らす
to live to no purpose
碌々として日を暮らすものではない
You should live to some purpose.
碌々としてなんら為す事も無く半生を暮らしてしまった
I have lived the best part of my life to no purpose.
呑気に暮らす
to lead a careless life―live a happy-go-lucky life
しゃれに暮らす
to have one's laugh―laugh one's laugh
無事平穏に暮らす
to live in peace and quiet―lead a tranquil life
夫婦仲好く暮らす
Man and wife live happily together.
仲悪く暮らす
to live on bad terms with each other―live a cat-and-dog life
一家むつまじく暮らす
The family live in harmony―live in concord.
面白く暮らす
to enjoy life
面白おかしく暮らす
to lead a merry life
泣いて暮らすも一生笑って暮らすも一生(だから面白おかしく暮らせ)
Lead a merry life!
クヨクヨして暮らす
to worry along―lead a dog's life of it
ビクビクして暮らす
to live in fear (of one's life)
生涯独身で暮らす
to live single―continue single through life
彼(彼女)は生涯独身で暮らした
He remained a bachelor through life―She lived and died a virgin.
あたら花を野で暮らす
She “wastes her sweetness on the desert air.”

content: 2. (=日を暮らす)to pass one's time; to spend one's time

content.content: 今日をどうして暮らそうか
How shall I pass my time?―spend my time?―(米国では)―put in the time?
どうして日を暮らしているか
How are you passing your time?
読書に日を暮らしている
I pass my time in reading―devote my time to reading.
彼は読書と庭いじりに日を暮らしている
He passes his time between the library and the garden.
休暇中はどこで暮らすつもりか
Where are you going to spend your holidays?
この休暇はどうして暮らしたら一番に面白いだろうか
How can I make the most of my holidays?
面白く日を暮らす
to enjoy oneself―have a good time
今日は面白く一日暮らした
I have enjoyed myself today―passed a pleasant day.
愉快に一週間暮らした
I have passed an agreeable week.
今日は紅葉狩りに一日暮らした
I have spent the day in maple-viewing.
彼女は毎日泣いて暮らしている
She passes every day in tears.
遊んで日を暮らす
to idle one's time away
夢を見て日を暮らす
to dream one's time away
寝て日を暮らす
to sleep one's time away
プラプラして日を暮らす
to dawdle one's time away―moon about―fool about―fool around
ノラクラして日を暮らす
to loiter one's time away―idle one's time away
ボンヤリして日を暮らす
to mope one's time away
いかがお暮らしですか
How do you do?―How are you getting along?―How goes it with you?
無事に暮らしております
I am quite well―I am getting along all right.
待てど暮らせど来そうな様子が無い
I waited and waited, but there was no sign of his coming.

No new theory or doctrine should shake your faith.
決心がグラつく

このような負けようをしては国家がグラつく

内閣がグラついて来た
The Ministry is tottering to its fall.

clubs are trumps
クラブの一
the ace of clubs

content:
くらぶ〔倶楽部〕
〈名〉A club

content.content: 倶楽部を起こす

倶楽部を維持する
to maintain a club―keep a club going
倶楽部に出入りする
to be free of a club
