I am made free of the club.
倶楽部員
a member of a club―a club-man

content:
くらべ〔比べ〕
〈名〉Comparison

content.content: この二つは比べものにならぬ
There is no comparison between the two.
これはあれとは比べにならぬ
This does not bear comparison with that―This does not compare with that―This is not to be compared with that―This is nothing like so good as that―This is nothing to that.
僕の勉強などは君の勉強にはとても比べにならぬ
My diligence is nothing to yours―nothing as compared with yours―as nothing compared with yours―nothing in comparison with yours.
英語では彼は君に比べにならぬ
His English is nothing to yours―His English is nothing like so good as yours―He is no match for you in English―He is not a patch upon you in English.
我々の苦労は彼らの苦労とは比べにならぬ
Our hardships are nothing to theirs―Our life is a paradise to theirs.

content:
くらべ〔比べ〕
〈接尾名詞〉A trial

content.content: 力比べ
a trial of strength
力比べする
to try one's strength against another's―measure one's strength with another's
力比べをしよう
Let us see which of us is the stronger!
背比べ
comparison of stature
背比べする
to measure oneself with another
腕比べ
a trial of ability
腕比べする
to match one's ability against another's―measure one's ability with another's
智慧比べ
a game of skill
智慧比べする
to play at a game of skill―measure one's wits with another's―match one's wits against another's
根気比べする
to see which can hold out longer―play the waiting game
今の戦争は根比べだ
Modern warfare is a waiting game.

content:
くらべる〔比べる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=比較する)to compare (one thing with another); to set (one thing against another); to weigh (one thing with or against another)

content.content: 翻訳を原文と比べてみた
I have compared the translation with the original.
賛成論と反対論を比べる
to weigh the pros and cons―weigh one argument with the other―weigh one argument against the other
反対候補者の人物を比べる
to weigh the merits of rival candidates
甲は乙と比べて優るか劣るか
How does the one compare with the other?
甲は乙と比べて劣らぬ
The one compares favourably with the other.
甲は乙と比べてはるかに劣る
The one does not compare with the other.
支那人は日本人に比べると背は高いが不活発だ
The Chinese, as compared with the Japanese, are taller but less active.
この作はあの作と比べると気品が高い
This work, as compared with that,―when set against that,―is of a higher tone.
今年は昨年と比べると生徒数が増している
The number of students has increased this year as compared with last.
日本人はロシア人に比べるとまるで子どもだ
The Japanese is a mere boy by the side of the Russian giant.
労働者の生活は船乗りの生活に比べると極楽だ
A labourer's life is a Paradise to a sailor's.
僕の成功などは君の成功に比べると顔色無しだ
My success pales beside yours.
身体の比べると頭が大き過ぎる
The head is too large for the body.
僕の勉強などは君の勉強に比べるとなんでもなくなる
My diligence is nothing to yours―nothing as compared with yours―as nothing compared with yours―nothing is comparison with yours.
日本刀に比ぶべきものは無い
Nothing can compare with the Japanese sword―There is nothing comparable to the Japanese sword―The Japanese sword stands unchallenged.

content: 2. (=競争する)to measure (one thing with another); to match (one thing against another)

content.content: 力を比べる
to measure one's strength with another's―match one's strength against another's
力を比べよう
Let us see which of us is the stronger!
背を比べる
to measure oneself with another
腕を比べる
to measure one's ability with another's―match one's ability against another's
智慧を比べる
to measure one's wits with another's―match one's wits against another's―play at a game of skill
根気を比べよう
Let us see which can hold out longer!―play the waiting game!

くらまえわたし〔倉前渡し〕
〈副〉Ex warehouse

content:
くらまぎれに〔暗紛れに〕
〈副〉Under cover of darkness; under favour of night

content.content: 暗まぎれに逃げ出した
She left the house under favour of darkness.

くらまごけ〔鞍馬苔〕
〈名〉The club-moss

content:
くらます〔眩ます〕
〈他動〉
1. To blind; to dazzle

content.content: 目をくらます
to dazzle one's eyes―(だますの意味なら)―blind one―hoodwink one―bamboozle one―throw dust in one's eyes―pull the wool over one's eyes
目をくらますばかりの輝き
The splendour is enough to dazzle the eye.
あれは我々の目をくらます手段だ
That is only a blind―That is a trick to throw dust in our eyes.
跡をくらます、踪跡をくらます
to cover one's traces―put one on the wrong scent―throw one off the scent
犯人が跡をくらました
The culprit has covered his traces―thrown the police off the scent.
跡をくらまして逃げる
to abscond―decamp
その男はそれっきり姿をくらました
He has vanished out of sight ever since.

content:
くらむ〔眩む〕
〈自動〉To be blinded; to be dazzled

content.content: 目がくらむばかりの輝き
The splendour is enough to dazzle the eye.
痴情に目がくらむ
to be blinded by passion
慾に目がくらむ
to be blinded by avarice
金に目がくらむ
to be blinded by love of money
彼は金銭に目のくらむような人でない
He is not the man to be blinded by love of money.
金の光に目がくらんだのだ
He was blinded by the power of money.

ぐらむ〔瓦<グラム>〕
〈名〉A gramme

ぐらむ〔瓦<グラム>〕
〈名〉A gramme

content:
くらやみ〔暗闇〕
〈名〉Darkness; the dark

content.content: 猫は暗闇で目が見える
The cat can see in the dark.
暗闇を手探りで行った
I groped my way in the dark.
暗闇でマッチを探った
I groped for the matches in the dark.
暗闇をすかして見る
to peer into the darkness
暗闇にまぎれて逃げた
He fled under cover of darkness―under favour of darkness.
暗闇の恥を明るみへ出す
to bring a secret disgrace before the public―“wash one's dirty linen in public”

content:
くらわす〔啗わす〕
〈他動〉To allure; to entice

content.content: くらわすに利をもってす
to entice one by hopes of gain―appeal to one's self-interest

くらわせる〔食わせる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=くわせる)to feed (a horse on beans, etc.)
2. (=打つ)to strike; to beat; to deal (one) a blow

くらわたし〔倉渡し〕
〈副〉Ex warehouse

content:
くり〔栗〕
〈名〉A chestnut:(栗の木)the chestnut-tree:(栗材)chestnut

content.content: 栗を拾う
to gather chestnuts
栗拾いに行く
to go nutting
栗のイガ
a chestnut-burr
栗が笑む
Chestnut-burrs burst open.
栗をむく
to crack a chestnut
桃栗三年
It takes a peach- or a chestnut-tree three years to begin to bear.
栗色
a chestnut-colour―hazel

くり〔庫裏〕
〈名〉The priests' quarters (in a temple)

content:
くりあい〔繰合い〕
〈名〉Arrangement

content.content: 時間の繰り合い
hour-arrangement
時間の繰り合いがつくか
Can you arrange the hours conveniently?
時間の繰り合いがついたか
Have the hours been arranged?
時間の繰り合いがついた
The hours are conveniently arranged.
時間の繰り合いがつかない
The hours can not be arranged―The hours do not lend themselves to arrangement.
時間の繰り合いが悪い
The hours are inconvenient.

content:
くりあげる〔繰り上げる〕
〈他動〉To move up; to carry up; to make (anything) earlier

content.content: 二時間目の英語を一時間目に繰り上げよう
We will move up the English from the second to the first hour.
一時間繰り上げる
to move up one hour―make it an hour earlier
明日はさし支えるから今日に繰り上げることはできませんか
I shall be engaged tomorrow. Can't you make it today?

content:
くりあわせる〔繰合わせる〕
〈自動〉To arrange matters; to manage it; to make time; to make it convenient (to do something)

content.content: 何とか繰り合わせて来られないか
Can't you make it convenient to come?―make time to come?
何とか繰り合わせがつくだろう
I think I can arrange matters―manage it―somehow.
何とか繰り合わせして出席しましょう
I will manage somehow to attend the meeting.
万障お繰合せ御出席被下度候
I hope nothing may prevent your attendance―You must come.

content:
くりいれ〔繰入れ〕
〈名〉Transfer:(=る) to transfer (a sum to fund)

content.content: 一万円は積立金に繰り入れた
10,000 yen has been transferred to the Reserve Fund.

くりいろ〔栗色〕
〈名〉A chestnut colour; hazel

content:
くりかえ〔繰替え〕
〈名〉
1. (=差繰りして替えること)change; exchange; shift:(=る) to change; to exchange; to shift

content.content: 時間を繰り替える
to change the hours
順序を繰り替える
to change the order
夜間は職工を繰り替える
The night shift takes the place of the day shift.

content: 2. (=差し繰り流用)diversion; appropriation:(=る) to divert, appropriate (funds to some other purpose)

content.content: 資本の一部を繰り替えて負債を返済した
A part of the capital has been diverted to―appropriated to―the payment of debts.
繰り替え払い
payment by appropriation

くりかえし〔繰返し〕
〈名〉Repetition; reiteration

content:
くりかえす〔繰返す〕
〈他動〉To repeat; to reiterate; to do (anything) over again; to say (anything) over again

content.content: 先生はほかの組へ行っても同じ事を繰り返す
He repeats the same thing―repeats himself―in the other classes.
同じことばかり繰り返すのが飽きた
I am tired of doing the same thing over and over again.
彼は繰り返し繰り返し同じことばかり言っている
He says the same thing over and over again―He does nothing but repeat himself―He is constantly harping on the same string.
繰り返して
over again
何度繰り返して
How many times over?
この本を三度繰り返して読んだ
I have read this book three times over.
ここに繰り返して言う必要は無い
It is unnecessary to repeat it here―The matter does not justify repetition.

くりからもんもん〔倶梨伽羅紋々〕
〈形〉Tattoed all over

content:
くりき〔功力〕
〈名〉Power; efficacy

content.content: 仏法の功力
the power of Buddhism
念仏の功力
the efficacy of prayer

content:
クリクリ
〈形、副〉Round

content.content: クリクリした大きな眼だ
He has big round eyes.
クリクリ坊主
a clean-shaven head
クリクリ坊主になる
to have one's head clean shaven

content:
グリグリ
〈名〉A lump (under the skin); a nodule

content.content: くびにグリグリができた
Lumps have formed in the neck.

content:
くりげ〔栗毛〕
〈形〉Chestnut (horse)
〈名〉A chestnut horse

content.content: 紅栗毛
a bay (horse)
栃栗毛
a dark-chestnut horse

content:
くりこし〔繰越し〕
〈名〉Transfer

content.content: 前ページよりの繰り越し
brought over―brought forward―brought down―from last page
次ページへの繰り越し
carried over―carried forward―to next page
前年度よりの繰り越し
brought over―brought forward―brought down―from last year's account
来年度への繰り越し
carried over―carried forward―to next year's account
繰り越し高
balance brought over―balance carried over
決算繰り越し日
a carrying-over day―a contango day

content:
くりこす〔繰越す〕
〈他動〉To transfer, bring over, bring forward, bring down (a sum from last year' account); to transfer, carry over, carry forward (a sum to next year's account, etc.)

content.content: 前ページより繰り越す
to bring over―bring forward―bring down―a sum from last page
次ページへ繰り越す
to carry over―carry forward―a sum to next page
残金を前年度より繰り越す
to bring over―bring forward―bring down―the balance from last year's account
後期へ繰り越す
to carry over―carry forward―the balance to next half-year's account
借金を繰り越す
to let a debt stand over

content:
くりごと〔繰言〕
〈名〉Repetition; tedious talk; garrulity

content.content: 繰り言を言う
to repeat the same thing over and over again―harp on the same string
老の繰り言お許しあれ
Excuse an old man's garrulity!

content:
くりこむ〔繰込む〕
〈他動〉
1. (=編入する)to assign (a recruit to the infantry or cavalry); to transfer (a time-expired soldier to the reserve)

content.content: 騎兵に繰り込まれた
I was assigned to the cavalry.
予備に繰り込まれた
I was transferred to the reserve.

content: 2. (=繰り入れる)to transfer (a sum to a fund)

content.content: 一万円は積立金に繰り込まれた
10,000 yen has been transferred to the Reserve Fund.

content: 3. (=繰り越す)to carry over, carry forward (a sum to next year's account)

content.content: 残金は来年度に繰り込む
The balance is carried over to next year's account.

content: 〈自動〉(=連中で入り込む)to file in; to march in

content.content: 吉原へ繰り込む
to march into the gay quarters―visit the gay quarters in a body
皆さんお揃いでこれからどちらへお繰り込みですか
You are quite a party. What is the objective?

content:
くりさげる〔繰下げる〕
〈他動〉To move down; to carry down

content.content: 後は順に繰り下げる
The rest to be carried down in order.

content:
くりだす〔繰出す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=糸などを繰出す)to let out, pay out (a line)

content.content: 縄を繰り出す
to pay out a rope
錨綱を繰り出す
to veer out the cable

content: 2. (=兵などを繰り出す)to file out, send out (troops)

content.content: 新手を繰り出す
to send out fresh troops
新手を繰り出して敵を食い止めた
Fresh troops were sent out to hold the enemy in check.
槍を繰り出す
to thrust out a spear

content: 〈自動〉(=連中が出かける)to file out; to march out; to troop out; to sally forth

content.content: 顔が揃ったからそろそろ繰り出そう
We are all here. Let us be marching out!
加勢を得て威勢好く繰り出した
Reinforced by new-comers, we sallied forth.

content:
くりぬく〔刳抜く〕
〈他動〉To excavate; to hollow out; to scoop out; to gouge out

content.content: 土人は木をくり抜いて独木舟を造る
The natives make canoes by excavating wood.
南瓜をくり抜いて中へろうそくを立てて灯籠をこしらえる
A lantern is made of a scooped-out pumpkin with a lighted candle inside.
目玉をくり抜く
to gouge out one's eyes

content:
くりのべ〔繰延べ〕
〈名〉Postponement; deferment:(=る) to postpone; to defer; to put off

content.content: 軍艦建造を繰り延べることになった
The construction of warships has been postponed.
事を繰り延べることした
We have deferred matters.

content:
グリハマ
〈名〉Going wrong

content.content: なにもかもグリハマだ
Everything goes wrong (with me)―goes against me.

content:
くりまわし〔繰回し〕
〈名〉Contrivances; shifts; makeshifts; shifting and contriving; cutting and contriving

content.content: 繰りまわしをつける
to contrive―shift―make shift―shift and contrive―cut and contrive
どうか繰りまわしをつけよう
I will shift as I can.
あの女は繰りまわしが上手だ
She is a good contriver―good at cutting and contriving―shifty.
繰りまわし女
a notable housewife
稼ぎ男と繰りまわし女がよく揃った
A hard-working man and a notable wife make a good pair.

content:
くりまわす〔繰廻わす〕
〈自動〉To contrive; to shift; to make shift; to shift and contrive; to cut and contrive

content.content: あの女は上手に繰り廻す
She is a good contriver―good at shifting and contriving―shifty.
どうか繰りまして行こう
I will shift as I can.

content:
くりもの〔刳物〕
〈名〉Turnery

content.content: 刳物師
a turner
刳物細工
turnery

くりん〔九輪〕
〈名〉A nine-ringed spire (on the top of a pagoda)

くりんそう〔九輪草〕
〈名〉A kind of primrose

content:
くる〔繰る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=糸を引出す)to spin (cotton into thread)
2. (=糸を框{かまち}に巻く)to reel (thread)
3. (=綿繰器械で綿の種を去る)to gin (cotton)
4. (=順に送る)to move (up or down) in order

content.content: 繰り上げる
to move up―carry up
繰り下げる
to move down―carry down
雨戸を繰る
to draw the shutters
戸を繰る
to open ［draw］ a sliding door

content: 6. (=本の紙などを順に開いて調べる)to turn over (the leaves); to refer to (a dictionary); to consult (the calendar, etc.)

content.content: 本を一枚一枚繰る
to turn over the leaves of a book
字引を繰って見る
to refer to a dictionary―consult a dictionary
暦を繰って見る
to consult the calendar―refer to the calendar
帳面を繰って見る
to refer to one's note-book
数が多いから帳面をくってみなけりゃわからん
There are so many that I must refer to my notes.
知っている人の数を心中で繰って見た
I boxed the compass of my acquaintances.［注意］“To box the compass”(羅針盤の三十二点を順に暗誦する)より出た。

content:
くる〔来る〕
〈自動〉
1. To come; to be here; to turn up; to join (one); to visit (a place)

content.content: 医者が来たか
Has the doctor come?
来ました(来ている)
He has come―He is here.
医者は今日来た(来て帰った)
The doctor has been here today.
僕は今晩来る
I am coming this evening―I shall be here in the evening.
僕は今来たばかりだ
I have just come―have only just come―have but just come.
その人はまだ来ない
He has not come yet―not turned up yet.
試験のことを聞きに来た
I came to inquire about the examination.
話しに来た、遊びに来た
I came to have a chat with you―I came for a chat.
ちと遊びに来給え
Come to see me!
今晩来ないか
Won't you come to see me―join me―this evening?
困ったら俺のところへ来い(頼みに来い)
When you are in need, come to me―When you need a friend, remember that you have on in me.
田中さんが来た
Here is Mr. Tanaka!
又来たよ
Here I am again!
来た来た
Here he comes!
さあ鎌倉へ来ました
Here we are at Kamakura.
向こうから来る電車が上野行きだろう
That car coming this way must be bound for Ueno.
僕はここへ来てから五年になる
It is five years since I came here―since I have been here.
君は何用があって来たか
On what business have you come?―(他動詞構文にすれば)―What business has brought you here?
大事な用があって来た
I come on important business―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Important business brings me here.
病気で来られなかった
I could not come on account of illness―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Illness prevented me from coming―prevented my coming.
朝は来られなかった、晩なら来られたのだ(が事実来なかった)
I could not come in the morning; I could have come in the evening.
君はいつ帰って来るか
When are you coming back?―When shall you be back?―When do you return?
この品を取りに来るまで預かってくれ給え
Please keep the article for me till I come for it―call for it.
人が僕を呼びに来た
A man has come for me.
家族は後から来る
My family are coming over after me.
彼は従弟と連れだって来た
He came in company with his cousin.
その人は日本へ来たことがある
He once came to Japan―visited Japan.
今晩また来る
I will come again―call again―return―rejoin you―this evening.
さあ来い
Come on!
誰でも来い俺が相手になってやる
Let any one come, I am his man.

content: 2. (=来ている)to have come

content.content: 医者が来ている
The doctor has come―The doctor is here.

content: 3. (=来たことがある)to have been here

content.content: 君はここへ来たことがあるか
Have you been here before?―Did you ever come here before?
二三度来たことがある
I have been here two or three times.

content: 4. (=来られる)to have (one) come

content.content: 僕は人に来られることが好きだ
I like to have people come.
明日は大勢に来られる
I shall have many people come tomorrow―I expect many visitors tomorrow.
忙しい時人に来られるのはまっぴらだ
I don't like to have people come when I am busy.

content: 5. (=来て見る)to find

content.content: 君はいつ来て見ても勉強している
I always find you at your books.
来て見ればさほどにもなし富士の山
I find the fame outrun the reality.

content: 6. (=見て来る)to go and see

content.content: 何事だか見て来い
Go and see what is the matter.
何事だか聞いて来ます
I will go and ask what is the matter.

content: 7. (=どこそこへ行って来た)to have been to (some place)

content.content: 日光へ行って来た
I have been to Nikko.
花見に行って来た
I have been to see the blossoms.
暇乞いに行って来た
I have been to take leave of my friends.
どこへ行って来たか
Where have you been?
じきに行ってじきに帰って来る
I will be there in a trice, and be back in a jiffy.

content: 8. (=こうなって来る)to come to, get to, grow to, begin to(be or do something)

content.content: 僕はあの人が好きになって来た
I have come to like him.
天気が好くなってきた
The weather is getting to be fine.
英語がだんだんわかってきた
I begin to understand English better.
英語が面白くなってきた
I am getting interested in the study of English.
話が面白くなってきた
The story is becoming interesting―The plot thickens.

content: 9. (=手紙などが来る)to come to hand

content.content: この手紙は今来たばかりだ
This letter has just come (to hand).
その手紙は誰へ来たのか
Whom is that letter for?
僕に来た手紙はありませんか
Are there any letters for me?
国から手紙が来た
I had a letter from home.

content: 10. (=汽車や船が来る)to come in

content.content: 汽車が来た
The train has come in―The train is in.
船が来るまで待とう
I will wait till the boat comes in.

content: 11. (=季節などが来る)to come; to come round; to set in

content.content: 待ちに待った日が来た
The long wished-for day has come.
こうやっておけば正月がいつ来てもさし支えない
The New Year may could round at any time, and it shall find us ready.
寒くなってきた
Cold weather has set in―It is getting colder.
勉強しているうちに時節が来れば成功する
If you keep working hard, you will succeed in time―in due time―in due season.

content: 12. (=風雨などが来る)to come on

content.content: しばらくすると吹いて来た
Soon it came on to blow.
暴風雨が猛威を極めて襲い来た
The storm burst upon us in all its fury.
雨が降って来た
It has begun raining.

content: 13. (=付いて来る)to follow (one); to accompany (one)

content.content: 僕の犬は僕の行く所へどこでも来る
My dog will follow me wherever I go.
僕と来たけりゃ来てもよい
You may come with me―accompany me―if you want to.

content: 14. (=来訪する)to come to see (one); to call (on one); to look in (upon one); to drop in (upon one); to blow in (upon one)

content.content: ちと遊びに来給え
come to see me!
好く来て下すった
It is very good of you to come―I am glad to see you.
二三の友人がふとやって来た
A few friends dropped in―blew in.
いつ来てくれるか
When will you call on me?
また来給え
Please call again!

content: 15. (=伝来する、渡来する)to be brought (to Japan); to be introduced (into Japan)

content.content: タバコはいつ来たものか
When was tobacco introduced into Japan?
仏教は支那朝鮮を経て日本へ来た
Buddhism was introduced into Japan through China and Korea.
火器はポルトガル人の手を経て初めて日本へ来た
Fire-arms were first brought to Japan by the Portuguese.

content: 16. (=由来する)to come (of some cause); to be derived (from some origin); to be traced (to some source)

content.content: 君の病気は飲み過ぎから来るのだ
Your illness comes of drinking too much.
英語は多くラテン語から来ている
Many English words are derived from Latin.
日用の日本語で仏教から来ているのがたくさんある
Many everyday Japanese expressions are to be traced to Buddhism.

content:
17. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 車が来ました
The kuruma is at the door.
誰か来たようだ
There is some one at the door.
彼は今にも来るかと待っている
I expect him every moment.
きみは今日は来るか明日は来るかと待っていた
I have been expecting you every day.
今日は友人が来るはずだ
I expect a friend today.
泳いで来られんか
Can't you swim it?
車が無いから歩いて来た
As no kuruma was to be had, I had to walk it.
てくてく歩いて来た
I had to trudge it.
仙台から電信で呼びに来た
I have been wired for from Sendai.
車を持って迎えに来た
They have sent a kuruma for me.
ここへ来る途中彼の所へ寄って来た
I looked in upon him on my way here.
日本へ来る途中船はハワイへ寄港した
We touched at Hawaii on our way to Japan―en route to Japan.
あのような先生は飽きが来ない
Such teachers wear well.
けんかなら来い
If it is a quarrel, I am your man.
よし来た引受けた
All right! I will see to it.
一昨日来い
Never darken my door in future!

くる〔刳る〕
〈他動〉To bore (a hole); to scoop out (a pumpkin); to gouge out (the eyes, etc.)

content:
グル
〈名〉(事)collusion; conspiracy; confederacy:(人)confederates; conspirators; accomplices

content.content: 誰とグルになる
to collude with―conspire with―some one
二人はグルになって僕をだました
They conspired together to cheat me.
案内者は馬賊とグルになっている
The guides are in league with the bandits.
二人はグルになってお互いの利益を図る
They play into each other's hands.
彼奴らは皆グルだ
They are all accomplices―conspirators―confederates―in league with each other.

content:
くるい〔狂い〕
〈名〉
1. (=狂乱)madness

content.content: 女狂いする
to run mad after a woman
女が役者狂いする
A woman runs mad after an actor.
死物狂いになる
to be driven to desperation
狂い死にする
to rave oneself to death

content: 2. (=順序の狂い)disorder

content.content: 順序に狂いを生じた
The order has gone wrong―They are in wrong order.

content: 3. (=手順の狂い)derangement; disarrangement; disconcertment; disturbance; dislocation

content.content: 人員が一人欠けたために手筈に狂いを生じた
The failure of one of the members has deranged my plans―disconcerted my plans―dislocated my plans―upset my plans.
どうかして狙いに狂いを生じた
Something disturbed my aim.

content: 4. (=相場の狂い)fluctuation

content.content: 相場には狂いがある
The prices are subject to fluctuations.

content: 5. (=建物や細工物などの狂い)warp; craziness; ricketiness

content.content: 生ま木は狂いが来る
Unseasoned wood warps.
家は生ま木で建てたものだから狂いが来た
The house, being built of unseasoned wood, has gone crazy―fallen rickety.
この椅子は狂いが来ている
The chair is crazy.
狂いの来た梯子段
a crazy staircase―a rickety staircase
戸に狂いが来た
The door will not open or shut.

くるいざき〔狂い咲き〕
〈名〉Blossoms out of season:(=する) (a tree) blossoms out of season

くるいじに〔狂い死に〕
〈名〉Raving oneself to death:(=する) to rave oneself to death

くるいばな〔狂い花〕
〈名〉Blossoms out of season

content:
くるう〔狂う〕
〈自動〉
1. (=狂乱する)to rave; to rage

content.content: 発狂者が狂い廻る
A madman raves about―rips and tears about.
暴風雨が荒れ狂う
The storm rages.
彼は女優に狂っている
He is running mad after an actress.

content: 2. (=気が狂う)to go mad; to go distracted; to lose one's wits; to lose one's senses; to be bereft of reason

content.content: 彼は気が狂っている

He is mad―insane―crazy―bereft of reason―cracked―crack-brained―unsound in mind―out of his mind―out of his wits―out of his senses―off his head――not in his right mind―not right in his head―wrong in the upper story.
彼はあまり悲しがって気が狂った
Grief has turned his brain.
彼らは気が狂わんばかりに悲しんだ
They were frantic with grief.
気が狂わんばかりに悦んだ
They were frantic with joy.
彼は気が狂わんばかりに苦んだ
He was mad with pain.

content: 3. (=機械が狂う)to get out of order; to be thrown out of gear; to go wrong

content.content: 機械が狂っている
The machine is out of order―out of gear.
精巧な機械は狂いやすい
Delicate machinery is apt to get out of order―easily thrown out of gear.
僕の腹は狂いやすい
My bowels easily get out of order.
時計が狂った
My watch has gone wrong.
(楽器などの)調子が狂う
to get out of tune

content: 4. (=建物、細工物などが狂う)to warp; to go crazy; to fall rickety

content.content: 生ま木は狂う
Unseasoned wood warps.
家は生ま木で造ったから狂った
The house, being built of unseasoned wood, has gone crazy―fallen rickety.
この椅子は狂っている
The chair is crazy.
建物が狂っている
The building is rickety.
狂った梯子段
a crazy staircase―a rickety staircase
戸が狂った
The door will not open or shut.

content: 5. (=順序、手順などが狂う)to go wrong; to be deranged; to be disconcerted; to be dislocated; to be upset

content.content: 順序が狂った、番が狂った
The order has gone wrong―They are in wrong order.
人員が一人欠けたので手筈が狂った
The failure of one of the members has deranged our plans―disconcerted our plans―dislocated our plans―upset our plans.
予算が狂った
My estimates have gone wrong.
人数が増えたので予算が狂った
The addition to the party has upset my calculations.
病気してすっかり計画が狂ってしまった
My illness has upset all my plans.

content: 6. (=秩序、狙いなどが狂う)to be disturbed

content.content: どうかしたために狙いが狂った
Something disturbed my aim.
秩序が狂っている
Order is disturbed.

content: 7. (=相場が狂う)to fluctuate (in price)

content.content: 株は相場が狂いやすい
Stocks fluctuate in price―Stocks are subject to fluctuations.
大戦争で万事の相場が狂った
The Great War has dislocated the world.

content: 8. (=計略などが狂う)to be baffled, be baulked, be defeated, be foiled, be frustrated (in one's design); to be disconcerted; to be discomfited

クルクル
〈副〉Round and round

content.content: 車がクルクル廻る
A wheel turns round and round.
独楽がクルクル廻る
A top spins round and round.
酒を飲むと座敷がクルクル廻る
When I am drunk, the room swims before my eyes―reels before my eyes.

content:
グルグル
〈副〉Round and round

content.content: グルグルまわる
to turn round and round
ルグルまわす
to turn anything round and round
帯をグルグル巻きに巻きつける
to wind a belt round and round oneself

content:
くるしい〔苦しい〕
〈形〉Painful (disease); afflicting (circumstance); distressing (poverty); trying (experience); agonizing (feeling); oppressive (heat); narrow, straitened (circumstances); embarrassed (finances); awkward, delicate (position); hard (labour); difficult (breathing); forced (laugh); laboured (style); strained (explanation); far-fetched (argument, etc.)

content.content: ああ苦しい、苦しくてたまらぬ
I am in agony―It is trying―I can't stand it.
彼は苦しそうにうなっていた
He was groaning as if in pain―as if in agony.
生活が苦しい
Life is hard―Life is difficult.
暑さが苦しい
The heat is oppressive.
苦しい財政
embarrassed finances―financial embarrassment
彼は財政(生計)が苦しい
He is in straitened circumstances.
僕は苦しい立場だ
I am in an awkward situation.
君にそうされると僕は苦しい立場になる
You place me in a delicate position.
僕は借金で苦しい
I am embarrassed by debts.
貧乏で苦しい
I am distressed by poverty.
およそ世の中に貧乏ぐらい苦しいものは無い
Nothing in the world can be more distressing than poverty.
重税が苦しい
I am oppressed by heavy taxation―The taxes bear hard on me.
彼は見えを張っているけれども内実はずいぶん苦しいのだ
Though he makes a brave show, he is really in straits―in great straits.
胸が苦しい
I fell oppressed in the chest.
病人は息が苦しそうだ
The invalid seems to breathe with difficulty.
仕事が苦しい
The work is hard―I feel the strain on my powers.
仕事が苦しくてたまらない
The strain is intolerable―I can't stand the strain.
彼らは仕事が苦しい苦しいと言っている
They complain of the strain.
苦しい思いをした、苦しい目に逢った
I had a trying experience―I had a hard time of it.
居ても立っても居られないような苦しい思いをした
I was in agony―My soul was wrung with agony.
僕は苦しい境遇に立っている
I am in a trying situation―in extremity―reduced to extremity.
苦しい時の神頼み
“One will pray to the gods in extremity.”
苦しい時は身一つ
“Everybody for himself, and God for us all.”
僕は苦しい羽目に陥っている
I am in a tight place―in a tight box―in a cleft stick―in a fix.
腹が苦しい
I am full―as tight as a drum.
苦しい言い訳だ
It is a forced excuse―a lame excuse.
苦しい洒落だ
It is a strained joke―a far-fetched pun.
苦しい説明だ
It is a strained explanation―a forced explanation―a far-fetched explanation.
苦しい文章だ
It is a laboured style.
苦しいからひと思いに殺しておくれ
Put me out of misery!―Release me from my miseries!
彼は苦しくなると何とかかとかごまかして言い抜ける
When he finds himself in hot water, he will dodge and shuffle out of the difficulty.
英語が苦しくなると日本語を出す
When he can not express himself in English, he will fall back upon his Japanese

content:
ぐるしい〔苦しい〕
〈接尾詞〉［注意］訳語一定せず。

content.content: この室は息苦しい
This room is close.
見苦しい
(家なら)an unsightly building―(行動なら)―unbecoming conduct―(挙動なら)―unseemly behaviour
君がそんなことをしては見苦しい
It would be unbecoming in you to do such a thing.
君がそんなことを言っては聞き苦しい
It sounds strange from your lips.
今晩は寝苦しい晩だ
I can not sleep tonight.
昨晩は寝苦しかった
I tossed about in bed all last-night―I have passed a bad night.
いつまでもご厄介になっているのは心苦しい
It goes against my conscience to impose upon your hospitality for ever.

content:
くるしからず〔苦しからず〕
〈助動詞相当〉May

content.content: 全部一回に上納するも苦しからず
All may be paid up at a time.
郵券代用不苦
payable in stamps

content:
くるしがる〔苦しがる〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: くるしむ〔苦しむ〕
苦しがって苦悶する
to writhe with pain

content:
くるしさ〔苦しさ〕
〈名〉Agony; anguish; strain (on one's nerves)

content.content: その苦しさはたえられぬ
I can not stand the strain―The strain on my nerves is more than I can bear.
苦しさにたえかねて声を揚げた
I cried out in anguish of heart.

content:
くるしまぎれに〔苦し紛れに〕
〈副〉In the excess of one's pain; in anguish of heart; under the pressure of necessity; in a fit of desperation; driven by despair

content.content: 苦し紛れに声を揚げた
I cried out in anguish of heart.
これは必要に迫って苦し紛れに借りた金だ
The money borrowed under the pressure of necessity.
彼は苦し紛れに(やけになって)何をしでかすか知れたもんじゃない
There is no saying what he may do in a fit of desperation.
彼は苦し紛れに(絶望の極み)自害した
He was driven by despair to suicide―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Despair drove him to suicide.

content:
くるしみ〔苦しみ〕
〈名〉Pain; suffering; distress; affliction; torture; torment; anguish; agony; throes; misery; tribulation

content.content: 行ってみると彼は七転八倒の苦しみ最中
I found him in agonies.
女子は男子よりも苦しみに堪える
Woman can bear suffering better than man.
黙って苦しみを忍べ
Bear your sufferings in silence!―Be patient in tribulation!
苦しみに堪えかねて声を揚げた
I cried out in anguish of heart.
彼女の苦しみを見るに見かねた
I could not bear to see her distress.
ひと思いに殺してこの苦しみを助けておくれ
Put me out of misery!―Release me from my miseries!
この病にかかっては一生の苦しみだ
The disease if a lifelong torment―a lifelong torture.
断末魔の苦しみ
death agony―the throes of death―the pangs of death
死ぬ苦しみをした
I suffered deathlike agony.
産の苦しみ
travail―labour-pains―the throes of childbirth
病の苦しみ
the affliction of disease
良心の苦しみ
the pricks of conscience―the pangs of remorse

content:
くるしむ〔苦しむ〕
〈自動〉
1. To suffer (from an illness); to labour (under some defect); to groan (under oppression); to be agonized (by terror); to be afflicted (with a disease); to be troubled (with a headache); to be tortured (by thirst); to be tormented (by anxiety); to be distressed (by poverty); to be embarrassed (by debts); to be oppressed (by heavy taxation); to be pressed (by hunger); to be in pain

content.content: 冬は貧民が苦しむ
The poor suffer in winter.
病人は夜眠れないほど苦しむ
The invalid suffers so much that he can not sleep of nights.
病人はたいそう苦しんでいる
He is in pain―in great pain.
彼は空をつかんで苦しんだ
He clutched at the air in his agonies.
彼はもっと苦しまなけりゃ(もっと苦しませなけりゃ)目が覚めぬ
He will not come to his senses unless he suffers more.
もっと苦しめば目が覚める
More suffering will bring him to his senses.
彼はリウマチで苦しんでいる
He is suffering from rheumatism―afflicted with rheumatism.
かの地方は給水不足に苦しむ
The district suffers from scarcity of water.
農作物は降雨欠乏に苦しむ
The crops suffer from want of rain.
戦争があると人民が苦しむ
When there is a war, the people suffer from it―(他動詞構文にすれば)―A war bears hard on―weighs heavily on―the people.
人民が重税に苦しんでいる
The people are oppressed by heavy taxation―The people groan under the heavy burdens―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The taxes bear hard on―weigh heavily on―the people.
人民は圧制に苦しむ
The people groan under oppression―crouch under oppression.
あの人は訥弁で苦しんでいる
He labours under a defect of speech.
貧に苦しむ
One is distressed by poverty.
借金で苦しむ
One is embarrassed by debts.
渇に苦しむ
One is distressed by thirst―tortured by thirst
飢渇に苦しむ
One is pressed by hunger.
人は飢渇に苦しんで始めて働く
Men only work under the pressure of hunger.
無聊に苦しむ
One is oppressed with tedium―oppressed with ennui.
彼は無事に苦しんでいる
He does not know what to do with himself―Time hangs heavily on his hands.
人は無事に苦しむと酒やばくちを始める
When a man has nothing to do, he will take to drinking and gambling.
候補者が多くて選択に苦しむ
There are so many candidates that the choice is embarrassing―We have an embarrassing choice of candidates.

content: 2. (=何に窮す)to be perplexed (what to do); to be puzzled (what to make of it); to be at a loss (how to act); to be pressed (for money); to be hard up (for money)

content.content: 不意を打たれて返答に苦しんだ
Taken by surprise, I was at a loss for an answer.
処置に苦しんでいる
I am at a loss how to act―I am perplexed (what step to take).
問題の解決に苦しんでいる
I am at a loss for a solution of the problem―puzzled how to solve the problem.
その意を解するに苦しむ

I can not make out what he means―I am at a loss to comprehend what he is driving at―What he can mean, is more than I can tell―What he can mean, is above my comprehension―What he can mean, is a mystery to me.
彼は金策に苦しんでいる
He does not know how to raise the money―He is pressed for money―He is hard up (for money).

content: 3. (=努力する)to struggle; to strive; to labour; to agonize

content.content: 英語を修めるのにうんと苦しんだ
I struggled hard―strove hard―to master English.
彼は十年苦しんでようやく成功した
He struggled for ten years, till at last he succeeded.
こんなに苦しんで覚えた商売をどうして止められよう
How can I give up a profession which I strove so hard to master?
苦しまなければ一芸に達することはできぬ
One can not master a business without labour.
何を苦しんで
Why should...?
いくらも容易な方法があるのに何を苦しんでそんな窮策を用いるか
There are many easier ways of doing it. Why should we resort to such shifts?

content:
くるしめる〔苦しめる〕
〈他動〉To torment; to torture; distress; to afflict; to trouble; to worry; persecute (a sect); to harass (the enemy); to oppress (one's spirits); to embarrass (one's finances); to agonize (one's feelings); to wring (one's heart); to rack (one's frame, etc.)

content.content: 彼は人を苦しめて悦んで居る
He takes a malicious pleasure in tormenting people.
彼は苦しめられてとうとう白状した
He was tortured into confession.
蚤や蚊に苦しめられて一晩寝ずに明かした
The fleas and mosquitoes tormented me and kept me awake all night.
敵を苦しめて退去さした
We harassed the enemy into retreat.
貧乏に苦しめられる
One is distressed by poverty.
借金に苦しめられる
One is embarrassed by debts.
人民は重税に苦しめられる
The people are oppressed by heavy taxation―The taxes bear hard on the people.
病に苦しめられる
One is afflicted with a disease―troubled with a disease.
借金取りに苦しめられる
I am worried by duns.
なにゆえ汝はかく我れを苦しめるか
Why do you persecute me so?
なにゆえ汝はそのようなことを言って我が心を苦しめるのか
Why do you wring my heart―agonize my feelings―by saying such things?
身体を苦しめる
to torture one's body―rack one's frame

くるっぷほう〔クルップ砲〕
〈名〉A Krupp gun

くるびょう〔佝僂病〕
〈名〉Rickets; rachitis

くるぶし〔踝〕
〈名〉The ankle; the ankle-bone

content:
くるま〔車〕
〈名〉
1. (=車輪)a wheel

content.content: 車が廻る
A wheel turns.
車を廻す
to turn a wheel
車の跡
ruts
車仕掛
wheel-work
車井戸
a wheel-well
車大工
a wheel-wright―a cart-wright―a carriage-builder

content: 2. (=馬車や人力車や荷車の総称)a vehicle:(俥)a ricksha:(荷車)a cart

content.content: 俥に乗る
to ride in a ricksha
(下から)俥に乗る、俥から降りる
to get into a ricksha―get out of a ricksha
俥で行こう
Let us go by ricksha!
俥を飛ばして行って来る
I will go by ricksha―take a ricksha.
俥を呼んで下さい
Please send for a ricksha!
お俥が参りました
The ricksha is at the door.
俥が無いから歩いて来た
There was no ricksha to be had, and I had to walk it.
俥を抱える
to keep a ricksha
ここに住めば俥を抱える世話は無い
If you live here, you will not have to go to the trouble and expense of keeping a ricksha.
車(俥)を曳く
to draw a cart―pull a ricksha
横に車を押す
(直訳すれば)to push a cart sideways―(意訳すれば)―attempt the impossible―force the situation
車に積む
to load a cart
車に米を積む
to load a cart with rice
ひと車の道具
a cartload of furniture
道具が車に五台ある
There are five cartloads of furniture.
新宅へ車で幾台も道具を運んで来た
Cartloads of furniture arrived at the new house.
車で荷物を運ぶ
to carry goods in a cart―cart goods
智徳は車の両輪の如し
Knowledge and virtue are (like) the two wheels of a cart.
彼は火の車だ
He is in great straits.
車止め
No thoroughfare for vehicles.

くるまいど〔車井戸〕
〈名〉A wheel-well

くるまえび〔車海老〕
〈名〉The prawn

content:
くるまざ〔車座〕
〈名〉Sitting in a circle

content.content: 彼らは炉の周囲に車座になっていた
They sat around the fire in a circle―in a ring.

くるまだい〔俥代〕
〈名〉A present of money made to a messenger

くるまだいく〔車大工〕
〈名〉A wheel-wright; a cart-wright; a carriage-builder

くるまちん〔俥賃〕
〈名〉Fare; ricksha hire

くるまどめ〔車止め〕
〈名〉
1. No thoroughfare for vehicles
2. (=鉄道の車止め)a buffer-stop

くるまひき〔車曳き〕
〈名〉
1. (=人力車夫)a rickshaman
2. (=車力)a carter

くるまや〔車屋〕
〈名〉
1. (=人力車夫)a rickshaman
2. (=丁場)a ricksha-station
3. (=車大工)a wheel-wright; a cart-wright

くるまよせ〔車寄せ〕
〈名〉A porch

content:
くるまる
〈自動〉To wrap oneself up (in a blanket); to tuck oneself up (in bedclothes)

content.content: 蒲団にくるまっている
I am tucked up in bed―warmly covered up.
毛布にくるまっている
I am wrapt up in a blanket.

content:
くるみ〔胡桃〕
〈名〉The walnut

content.content: 胡桃を割る
to crack a nut
胡桃割り
a nut-cracker

content:
ぐるみ
〈接尾詞〉... and all; together with (something); inclusive of (something)

content.content: 着物ぐるみ焼いてしまう
to burn up the body, clothes and all
その金額は運賃ぐるみか
Is the sum inclusive of the carriage?
土地ぐるみ家を買った
I bought the house, together with the land.

content:
くるむ
〈他動〉To wrap (one in a blanket―a blanket about one); to lap (one in wraps―a blanket about one); to tuck up (a child in bedclothes)

content.content: 子どもを蒲団にくるんで寝かす
A child is tucked up in bed.
死骸を菰{こも}にくるんで河へ捨てた
The body was wrapt in a mat and thrown into the river.

content:
くるめる
〈他動〉
1. (=ひっくるめる)to lump (many items together―one thing with another)

content.content: くるめていくらに見積る
They are valued in the lump―in the gross―en masse.
くるめていくらで売るか
What will you take for them in the lump?―What do you ask all together?
くるめて言えば
To be short,―To be brief,―To make a long story short,...

content: 2. (=籠絡する)to cajole; to coax; to wheedle; to hoax; to fool

content.content: 彼はいい加減にくるめられている
He is fooled to the top of his bent.

content:
グルリ
〈名〉
1. (=周囲)the circumference (of anything)
2. (=周囲の事物、環境)one's environment; one's surroundings
3. (=居まわり)the environs, the surrounding country (of a town, etc.)
〈副詞、前置詞相当〉Round; around

content.content: グルリに人が立っていた
People were standing around.
家のグルリに垣根がある
There is a fence around the house.
グルリの家
the houses around
縁側がグルリと社をまわっている
A verandah runs round the shrine.
グルリと振向いた
I turned round―looked round.
グルリと取巻かれた
We were surrounded on every side.

content:
くるりと〔クルリと〕
〈副〉Round

content.content: クルリと廻る
to turn round―turn on one's heels

content:
くるりと〔クルリと〕
〈副〉Round

content.content: クルリと廻る
to turn round―turn on one's heels

content:
くるわ〔廓〕
〈名〉
1. (=囲い内)an enclosure; a quarter
2. (=遊廓)a prostitute quarter; a licensed quarter; a bad quarter; a gay quarter

content.content: 廓通いする
to frequent the gay quarters―frequent houses of ill fame
彼は廓へは足を入れたことも無い
He never set foot in a bad quarter.
廓の金には詰まるが習い
One who frequents gay quarters will soon want for money―The gay quarters will soon exhaust one's finances.

content:
くるわす〔狂わす〕
〈他動〉
1.

content.content: 気を狂わす
to drive one mad―drive one distracted―drive one to distraction
機械を狂わす
to put a machine out of order―throw a machine out of gear
順序を狂わす
to put things in wrong order
秩序を狂わす
to disturb order―throw anything into disorder
狙いを狂わす
to disturb one's aim
計略を狂わす、手筈を狂わす
to upset one's plans―disconcert one's plans―derange one's plans
敵の計略を狂わす
to baffle―baulk―defeat―foil―frustrate―disconcert―the enemy's design―discomfit the enemy
相場を狂わす
to affect the price―(わざとなら)―rig the market
開戦の噂が株の相場を狂わした
The rumour of war has affected the stock market.
大戦乱が万事の相場を狂わした
The Great War has dislocated the world.
成金が旅館や料理屋の相場を狂わした
The upstart millionaires have spoiled the hotels and restaurants.

content:
くれ〔暮れ〕
〈名〉
1. (=日暮れ)sunset; nightfall

content.content: 日の暮れに着いた
I arrived at nightfall―at sunset―at sundown.
日の暮れ前に行けるだろうか
Can we get there before dark?
日の暮れ過ぎになるだろう
We shall get there after dark.

content: 2. (=年末)the end of the year

content.content: 暮れには年中の勘定をする
All accounts are settled at the end of the year.
暮れも押し詰まりました
We are approaching the end of the year―The year draws to close.

content: 3. (=終り)the end, the close (of a season)

content.content: 夏の暮れのことであった
It happened at the end of summer―towards the close of summer―late in summer.

content:
くれがた〔暮方〕
〈副〉Towards nightfall

content.content: 暮方になって風がないだ
It fell calm towards evening.

content:
くれぐれも〔呉々も〕
〈副〉Over and over again; repeatedly; earnestly

content.content: くれぐれもお諫め申した
I earnestly expostulated with him on his mistake.
くれぐれも頼んだ
I repeatedly charged him to do so.
忠孝の道をくれぐれも言い聞かした
I inculcated on him the duties of loyalty and filial piety (here a little, there a little).

ぐれつ〔愚劣〕
〈形〉Foolish; stupid; absurd

くれない〔紅〕
〈名、形〉Deep red; crimson

content:
くれる〔呉れる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=与える)to give (one something)

content.content: その本をくれ
Give me that book!
水を一杯くれんか
Will you give me―get me―a glass of water?
彼は水を一杯くれと言った
He asked for a glass of water.
彼はあつかましくも金をくれと言った
He had the impudence to ask for money.
びた一文もくれとは言わぬ
I ask you for nothing.
彼はくれと言って手を出した
He held out his hand for some.
もっとくれと言って手を出した
He held out his hand for more.
(店へ行って)紙をくれ
I want some paper.
半分くれ
Give me half!―Go halves!―Snacks!
娘をくれてやる
to give one's daughter in marriage
(金などを)チビチビくれる
to give by driblets
貰う身よりもくれる身
“It is more blessed to give than to receive.”

content: 2. (=何々してくれ)(to do something) for me

content.content: ここ開けてくれ
Open the door for me!
この手紙を出してくれ
Post this letter for me.
この手紙を出さしてくれ
Have this letter posted.
時計を見せてくれ
Show me―Let me see―some watches.
時計屋へ入って時計を見せてくれと言った
I entered a watch-shop and asked to see some watches.
そのわけを聞かしてくれ
Tell me―Let me hear―the reason.
そのわけを聞かしてくれと言った
I demanded the reason.
靴を出してくれ
Bring me my shoes.
誰か君に学費を出してくれる人は無いか
Have you no one to supply you with your school-expenses?
外套を着せてくれ
Help me on with my overcoat!
外套を脱がしてくれ
Help me off with my overcoat!
目をくれる
to care for―attach importance to―anything
彼は金銭には目をくれない
He does not care for money.
彼は(金持ちだから)金銭問題には目をくれない
He attaches no importance to the question of expense―The consideration of expense does not weigh with him.

content:
くれる〔暮れる〕
〈自動〉
1.

content.content: 日が暮れる
Night falls―It grows dark.
今は何時に日が暮れるか
What time does night fall?
六時頃に日が暮れる
Night falls about six.
暮れるにはまだ間がある
It will not be dark for some time yet―It will be some time before it is dark.
暮れるには間もあるまい
It will soon be dark.
もう日が暮れた
It is night now.
トップリと日が暮れた
Night closed in―Darkness fell upon the scene.
日の暮れぬうちに行かれようか
Can we get there before dark?
日が暮れてからになるだろう
We shall get there after dark.
途中で日が暮れた
We were benighted―belated―on the road.
ばかにものを言っていると日が暮れる
I will not waste words on a fool.
グズグズしていると日が暮れるぞ
Look sharp!―Look alive!―Are you going to finish today?

content: 2. (=終わる)to end, come to an end; to close, draw to a close

content.content: 年が暮れる
The year comes to an end.
今年も暮れ行く
The year draws to a close.
早や今年も暮れた
The year has come to an end.
思案に暮れる
to be sunk in thoughts―lost in meditation
途方に暮れる
to be at a loss how to act―at one's wits' end
悲歎に暮れる
to abandon oneself to grief―have one's heart broken
一家は悲歎に暮れて居る
The family are sunk in grief―plunged in grief―broken-hearted.
一家は涙に暮れて居る
The family are drowned in tears.

content:
くろ〔黒〕
〈名、形〉Black

content.content: 黒馬
a black horse
黒米
uncleaned rice
黒豆
black soy-beans
黒胡麻
black-seeded sesame
黒パン
brown bread
黒柿
persimmon-wood
黒羅紗
black broadcloth
黒土
black earth
黒砂糖
brown sugar
黒ビール
black beer―M?nchen beer
緑の黒髪
raven locks
黒か紺の洋服
a suit of some dark colour

くろ〔畔〕
〈名〉A raised foot-path (between rice-fields)

くろあり〔黒蟻〕
〈名〉The back ant

content:
くろい〔黒い〕
〈形〉Black; swarthy; sable; dark; dusky

content.content: 烏は黒い
Crows are black.
黒くない烏もある
Crows are not always black.
彼は色が黒い
He has a dark complexion.
色の浅黒い苦味走った好い男だ
He is a dark handsome man.
彼女は髪が黒い
She has a jet-black head of hair.
黒い服を着た人
a man in black
あの男は腹が黒い
He is black-hearted―evil-hearted.
君は海水浴へ行ってずいぶん黒くなって来た
You have been pretty well sun-burnt―browned―tanned―at the seaside.
無患子{もくろじ}は三年磨いても黒い
“A crow is none the whiter for washing.”
頭の黒い鼠
a thievish servant
俺の目の黒いうちはお前たちに不自由はさせぬ
You shall not want for anything as long as I am alive.

くろいちご〔黒苺〕
〈名〉The blackberry; the thimble-berry

content:
くろう〔苦労〕
〈名〉
1. (=難儀)hardships; trials; difficulties; adversity; trouble:(=する) to undergo hardships; to go through hardships; to see hardships; to see life; to have one's trials; to suffer troubles; to contend with difficulties; to struggle with adversity; to have a hard time of it; to rough it

content.content: どんな身分でもそれぞれ苦労がある
Every situation in life has its trials.
誰でも苦労の無い人は無い
Everybody has his troubles.
彼は若い時苦労をしている
He has had many difficulties to contend with in his youth.
若い時世の中へ出て苦労をしている
He was early thrown upon the world, and had to struggle with adversity.
若い時の苦労は買ってもせよ
The young should struggle with adversity.
苦労は身の薬だ
“Sweet are the use of adversity.”
苦労で鍛え上げた人間だ
He has been trained in the school of adversity.
あの人はなかなか苦労をしている
He has seen much of life―seen many hardships―undergone many hardships―gone through much.
君らはまだ苦労が足りない
You have not seen enough of life.
若い時に働かないと年をとってから苦労する
Thoses who do not work in their youth, see hardships in their old age.
彼は好い息子でもあったらあの年であの苦労は無かろうに
If he had a son, he would not see such hardships in his old age.
この子を育てるにはずいぶんと苦労をしました
The boy cost me much trouble to bring up.
彼は北海道へ行ってずいぶん苦労をしたろう
He must have had a pretty hard time of it in Hokkaido.
苦学生は苦労くらいは平気だ
A self-supporting student is quite used to roughing it.
世間の苦労
the stern realities of life―the grim realities of life
彼は苦労をしたことが無い
He has seen nothing of life―He is a stranger to the stern realities of life.
彼はずいぶん苦労の多い生活だ
He leads a dog's life of it.
彼は細君が悪いから苦労する
His wife leads him a dog's life of it.
お前には苦労をさせた
I have led you a hard life.
苦労をし尽くす
to go through all sorts of hardships―drain the bitter cup to the dregs
人に苦労を掛ける
to give one trouble―cause one trouble―occasion one trouble
ご苦労様
Thanks for your trouble!―I am sorry to have given you such trouble.
遠路御苦労
Thanks for coming all the way!
お役目御苦労
You deserve well of the public.
御苦労千万な話だ(止せばよいのに)
He might have spared himself the trouble.

content: 2. (=心配)care; anxiety; concern; solicitude; trouble; worry; sorrow:(=する) to worry; to worry oneself; to be worried (about or over anything)

content.content: 家庭の苦労
family cares
世帯の苦労
household cares―domestic cares
学生生活は苦労が無い(呑気だ)
Student life is free form care.
僕は好きな仕事をしていると苦労が無い
I am quite happy with my congenial work.
苦労を忘れる
to banish care
酒を飲んで苦労をまぎらす
to drown care in wine
子どもの頃是無いおしゃべりを聞いていると浮世の苦労を忘れる
The innocent prattle of the child makes me forget the cares of life.
苦労は寿命を縮める
“Care preys upon life”―“Care is a foe to life”―“Care killed the cat.”
金持ち苦労多し
wealth brings anxieties with it
僕は苦労が絶えない
I have constant troubles on my hands.
彼は苦労があるから年が十も老けて見える
His troubles have added ten years to his age.
君は求めて苦労をしている様だ
You seem to seek your own troubles.
学生は試験で苦労する
The student worry over examinations―The students are worried over examinations.
あの人は始終金で苦労している
He is constantly worrying himself about money―worried about money.
恋の苦労をする
to feel or experience the sorrows of love
恋には苦労は付き物
Love is attended by sorrows―Sorrows attend on love.
あの子となら一苦労してみたい
I should like to share the sorrows of love with her.
僕は女で苦労をしたことが無い
I never felt the sorrows of love.
苦労をし尽くす
to drain the cup of sorrow to the dregs
苦労の種
a source of trouble―a thorn in one's side
苦労の種を蒔く
to sow the seed of future troubles
人の知らない苦労をする
“None but the wearer knows where the shoe pinches.”
親に苦労をかけて親の寿命を縮める
to “bring one's father's gray hairs to the grave”
それは親に苦労をかけた罰だ
That is a judgment for bringing your father's gray hairs to the grave.
苦労性
a nervous temperament
君はずいぶん苦労性だね
You take things too seriously.
取り越し苦労
overcare―over-anxiety―over-concern―over-solicitude
取り越し苦労をする
to meet trouble half-way―run to meet one's trouble
取り越し苦労をするな
Do not run to meet your trouble―Do not trouble trouble till trouble troubles you.
彼女は黙って取り越し苦労ばかりしている
She is eating her heart out.

content:
ぐろう〔愚弄〕
〈名〉Mockery:(=する) to mock, make a mock of (one); to tantalize; to give (one) a stone for bread

content.content: 人を愚弄した話だ
It is mockery.
口を極めて人を愚弄する
to laugh one to scorn

content:
くろうしょう〔苦労性〕
〈名〉Nervous temperament; pessimism

content.content: 僕は苦労性でつまらむことを気にかける
I am of a nervous temperament―I take trifles to heart.
君もずいぶん苦労性だね
You take things too seriously―You are a pessimist.

content:
くろうと〔黒人〕
〈名〉
1. A professional; a connoisseur; an adept; an expert:(その道に明るい黒人{くろうと})one in the line:(総称すれば)the initiated

content.content: この手際ならくろうともはだしだ
The performance would put a professional to shame―put a professional to the blush―do credit to a professional.
彼は書画にかけてはくろうとだ
He is a connoisseur in art―an adept in art.
その道のくろうとだ
He is in the line―in the business―in the trade.
本物かどうかくろうとの目にはすぐわかる
The genuineness of the article is clear to the professional eye―clear to the trained eye.
くろうとの目は盗めぬ
One can not deceive a professional eye―The blemish will not escape a trained eye.

content: 2. (=相場の黒人{くろうと})a professional speculator

content.content: くろうと筋
a regular operator

content: 3. (=女の黒人{くろうと})a professional woman; a woman of the town

content.content: くろうとにつかずしろうとにつかず極めて曖昧なものだ
She is neither flesh nor fish.

content:
くろうとめ〔黒人目〕
〈名〉A professional eye; a trained eye

content.content: 本物かどうかはくろうと目にはすぐわかる
The genuineness of the article is clear to the professional eye―clear to the trained eye.
くろうと目は盗めぬ
One can not deceive a professional eye―The Blemish will not escape a trained eye.

content:
くろうにん〔苦労人〕
〈名〉A man of the world; one who has seen much of life

content.content: あれはなかなか苦労人だ
He has seen much of life―gone through much.
あの苦労人がそんなばかなことをするはずが無い
He is too much of a man of the world not to know better.

content:
くろかみ〔黒髪〕
〈名〉Black hair; a black head of hair

content.content: 緑の黒髪
raven locks

くろぐま〔黒熊〕
〈名〉The black bear

content:
くろぐろと〔黒々と〕
〈副〉In deep black

content.content: 墨黒々と書く
to write in deep black
かね黒々と歯を染める
to dye one's teeth black

content:
くろこげ〔黒焦〕
〈名〉Charring:(=の) charred

content.content: 黒焦げにする
to char
黒焦げになる
to be charred
黒焦げの死体が出た
A charred body has been found.
飯が黒焦げになった
The rice is burnt black.

くろごま〔黒胡麻〕
〈名〉The black-seeded sesame

くろざとう〔黒砂糖〕
〈名〉Brown sugar

くろしお〔黒潮〕
〈固名〉The Black Current

content:
クロース
〈名〉(The book-binder's) cloth

content.content: 本はクロース綴
The book is bound in cloth.

content:
くろずきん〔黒頭巾〕
〈名〉A black hood

content.content: 黒頭巾をかぶる(蔭にまわる)
to get behind the scenes

content:
くろずんだ〔黒ずんだ〕
〈形〉Blackish; dark

content.content: 黒ずんだ柄が流行する
Dark-coloured patterns are in fashion.

content:
くろっぽい〔黒っぽい〕
〈形〉Blackish; dark

content.content: 黒っぽい柄が流行する
Dark-coloured patterns are in fashion.

content:
くろなじみ〔黒馴染〕
〈名〉A bruise

content.content: 目を打たれて黒馴染になった
I have a black eye.
全身黒馴染
to be black and blue all over

content:
くろぬり〔黒塗り〕
〈形〉Black-lacquered; black-varnished

content.content: 黒塗りの馬車
a black carriage

くろぱん〔黒パン〕
〈名〉Black bread; brown bread

くろびいる〔黒ビ―ル〕
〈名〉Black beer; M?nchen beer; porter

content:
くろびかり〔黒光り〕
〈名〉A black lustre

content.content: 黒光りする
to be shining black

くろひょう〔黒豹〕
〈名〉The panther

くろべい〔黒塀〕
〈名〉A black wooden wall

くろぼ〔黒穂〕
〈名〉(=麦の黒穂)Smut

content:
くろぼし〔黒星〕
〈名〉A black spot; the bull's-eye (of a target); a mark of defeat (among wrestlers)

content.content: 黒星にあてる
to hit the bull's-eye
西は東より黒星が多い
The West side suffered more defeats than the East.

content:
くろまく〔黒幕〕
〈名〉A wire-puller; the power behind the throne; some one behind the curtain; some one at the bottom of the affair

content.content: 黒幕になって人を操縦する
to pull the wires―pull the strings
黒幕は誰だ
Who is pulling the wires?―behind the curtain?―at the bottom of the affair?―the power behind the throne?
この事件にはだれか黒幕があるに違いない
There must be some one behind the curtain―There must be some one at the bottom of the affair―Some one must be pulling the wires.

くろまつ〔黒松〕
〈名〉The black pine; the seaside pine

くろまめ〔黒豆〕
〈名〉The black soy-bean

content:
くろみ〔黒味〕
〈名〉A black tinge; a black tint

content.content: 黒味を帯びている
to be tinged with black

content:
くろめ〔黒目〕
〈名〉The iris (of the eye)

content.content: 黒目がちの眼
black eyes

content:
くろめる〔黒める〕
〈他動〉To blacken

content.content: 鷺を烏に言い黒める
to talk black into white

くろもじ〔黒文字〕
〈名〉A toothpick

content:
くろやき〔黒焼き〕
〈名〉(事)charring:(物)anything charred:(=の) charred

content.content: 黒焼きにする
to char
いもりの黒焼き
a charred newt

content:
くろやま〔黒山〕
〈名〉A black hill

content.content: 黒山のような人だかり
a dense crowd
その外人の周囲に黒山のように人がたかった
People crowded about the foreigner―A crowd gathered about the foreigner.

くろらしゃ〔黒羅紗〕
〈名〉Black broadcloth

content:
くろわく〔黒枠〕
〈名〉Black-edges; mourning-borders

content.content: 黒枠付広告
a black. edged advertisement―a mourning-bordered advertisement
黒枠付封筒
a black-edged envelope
黒枠付書翰紙
mourning-paper

content:
クローン
〈名〉［電気］A coulomb

content.content: クローン計
a coulomb-meter

content:
ぐろん〔愚論〕
〈名〉A foolish opinion; absurd views

content.content: そりゃ愚論だ
Your views are absurd.

content:
くろんぼう〔黒奴〕
〈名〉
1. (=黒人)a negro(女性―negress); a blackamoor; a black; a blacky; a darky
2. (=芝居の黒奴)a prompter

content.content: 役者に黒奴が付く
An actor is prompted.

content: 3. (=麦の黒穂)smut

くわ〔桑〕
〈名〉The mulberry (-tree):(葉の意味なら)mulberry-leaves

content.content: 桑を摘む
to pick mulberry-leaves
蚕は桑を食う
The silkworm feeds on mulberry-leaves.
蚕に桑を食わせる
to feed the silkworm on mulberry-leaves―The silkworm is fed with mulberry-leaves
桑畑
a mulberry-field
桑の実
a mulberry

content:
くわ〔鍬〕
〈名〉A Japanese hoe:(文学にては)the plough

content.content: 鍬で土を掘る
to hoe up the soil
鍬を取る
to follow the plough
幕臣の多くは弓矢を捨てて鍬を取った
Many of the Shogunate vassals gave up the sword for the plough.
人の畑に鍬を入れる
to meddle in others' affairs―kiss one's neighbour's wife

content:
くわえぎせる〔銜え煙管〕
〈名〉A pipe in one's mouth

content.content: 彼はくわえ煙管で門にたたずんでおった
He was standing in the door, pipe in mouth.

くわえこむ〔銜え込む〕
〈他動〉(A girl) brings (a liver) with her (to an assignation-house)

content:
くわえる〔加える〕
〈他動〉
1. (=加算する)to add (one number to another); to add up (figures)

content.content: 五に六を加える
to add 6 to 5
二と二を加えれば四になる
Two and two make four
元金に利子を加える
to add the interest to the principal
数字を加える
to add up the figures―cast a column of figures

content: 2. (=付加する)to add, annex, append, subjoin (one thing to another)

content.content: 書面に僕の意見を加えて出した
The document was laid before my chief with my views added to it.
君の名を会員の中へ加えた
Your name has been added to the list of members.
但し書きを加える
to annex a proviso to a deed―subjoin a saving clause to a treaty
本に索引を加えるとよい
An index should be appended to the book.
人を仲間に加える
to receive a man into a company
僕もいっしょに加えて貰いたい
I wish to join the party.
改良を加える
to improve upon anything

content: 3. (=算入する)to include

content.content: 僕を加えて八人いる
There are eight of us, myself included.
下女下男を加えて家族十人
There are ten of us,inclusive of the servants.
雑費を加えて百円
The whole amounts to 100 yen, inclusive of expenses.

content: 4. (=増す)to grow; to gain (to some respect)

content.content: 日増しに暑気を加える
It is getting hotter and hotter every day―It daily grows hotter.
速力を加える
to gain in velocity―gather speed―become fasten
二人の交際は日々に親密を加える
Their relations daily grow in intimacy.
馬齢を加える
to find oneself a year older

content: 5. (=与える、蒙らす)to give (one a blow); to offer (one an insult); to inflict (damage on the enemy)

content.content: 打撃を加える
to give one a blow―give a blow to anything
鞭打ちを加える
to give one a whipping―give one a rope's end―lay on lashes
鞭撻を加える
to urge one to work hard
圧迫を加える
to bring pressure to bear on a man―put the screw on a man―put a man under the screw
圧力を加える
to subject anything to pressure
敵に害を加える
to inflict damage on the enemy
人体に危害を加える
to do one an injury―inflict a bodily injury upon a man
侮辱を加える
to offer an insult to a man―put an affront on a man
暴行を加える
to offer violence to a man
罰を加える
to inflict a punishment on the offender―visit the culprit with a punishment
制裁を加える
to put restraint on a man―put a man under restraint
意見を加える
to remonstrate with a man on his mistake―talk seriously to a man
医療を加える
to treat a patient―place a patient under medical treatment
筆を加える
to make corrections―add some touches―touch it up―revise a work
かててくわえて〔搗てて加えて〕
くおうるに〔加うるに〕

content:
くわえる〔銜える〕
〈他動〉To take (anything) in one's mouth; to seize (anything) in one's mouth; to seize (anything) between one's teeth

content.content: 犬が何かくわえている
The dog has something in his mouth.
犬が何かくわえて走って来た
The dog came running with something in his mouth.
彼は煙管をくわえている
He has a pipe in his mouth.
一人の男が煙管をくわえて門にたたずんでおった
A man was standing in the door with a pipe in his mouth―pipe in mouth.
猫が魚をくわえて行った
The cat has run away with a fish (in her mouth).
烏が鼠をくわえて飛んで行った
A crow seized a mouse (with its beak) and flew away―A crow flew away with a mouse (in its beak)
犬が僕の裾をくわえて引張った
The dog seized my skirt between his teeth, and pulled me.
子どもが指をくわえて眺めている
The child stands looking on with a finger in its mouth.
人が金を儲けるのを指をくわえて眺めているのは辛い
It is hard to look with envious eyes on people making a fortune.

content:
くわしい〔精しい、委しい、詳しい〕
〈形〉
1. (=詳細の)minute; circumstantial; particular; detailed

content.content: くわしい話
a minute account―a circumstantial account―a particular account―a detailed account
彼はその事件のくわしい話をした
He gave a minute account of the affair.
くわしい話をする
to enter into details―go into particulars
くわしい話はご免蒙る
You must excuse my going into details.
それは僕の不在中の出来事でくわしいことは存じません
It happened in my absence, and I don't know the particulars.
なおくわしいことは幹事にお尋ね下さい
For further particulars, I must refer you to my manager.
なおくわしいことは書面で差し出します
As for further details, I shall lay them before you in writing.

content: 2. (=精確な)accurate; exact; precise→『

content.content: くわしく〔精しく、委しく、詳しく〕

content:
』
3. 
〈叙述形容詞(動詞に訳して)〉(=精通する)to know well; to be familiar with (anything); to be conversant with (some affairs); to be well versed in (a subject); to be learned in (the law); to be will read in (literature); to be well posted up in (recent affairs)

content.content: 彼は支那の事情がくわしい
He is conversant with Chinese affairs.
歴史がくわしい
He is well versed in history.
法律がくわしい
He is learned in the law.
英文学がくわしい
He is well read in English literature.
現代文学にくわしい
He is well posted up in current literature.
君はこの辺の地理がよほどくわしいようだ
You seem to be well versed in the topography of these parts―You seem to know the neighbourhood very well―You seem to know every inch of the ground.
彼は沙翁{しゃおう=シェークスピア}の作がくわしい
He has Shakespeare at his fingers' ends.
実にくわしいものだ
He speaks like a book.

content:
くわしく〔精しく、委しく、詳しく〕
〈副〉
1. (=詳細に)minutely; circumstantially; particularly; in detail; at great length; at large

content.content: くわしく説明する
to explain in detail―explain at great length―explain at large
先生がここの意味をくわしく説明して下さった
My teacher explained the passage at great length.
彼はその事件をくわしく話した
He gave a minute account of the affair―gave a circumstantial account of the affair―gave a particular account of the affair―gave a detailed account of the affair.
くわしく話す
to enter into details―go into particulars
くわしく論ずる
to dwell upon a subject
この問題はくわしくは論じません
I shall not dwell upon the subject at any length.

content: 2. (=精確に)accurately; exactly; precisely:(と言うよりも)exact, precise(と形容詞に訳すこと多し)

content.content: そこはくわしく知っている
(I know exactly the place―と言わずして)I know the exact place―the precise spot.
彼の住所をくわしくは知らぬ
I don't know his exact address―exactly where he lives.
彼の言った事をくわしくは記憶しないが、何でも文法廃すべしという意味のようでした
I do not remember the exact words he used, but it was something to the effect that grammar should be done away with.
ここの意味がくわしくわからない
I can not get at the exact meaning of the passage.

content: 3. (=充分に)fully

content.content: 彼は英語をくわしく研究した
He has made a full study of English―made an accurate study of English.
事件はくわしく取り調べてみました
The matter has been fully investigated―probed to the bottom.

content:
くわずぎらい〔食わず嫌い〕
〈名〉Prejudice

content.content: 君は食わず嫌いだ
You are prejudiced against it.

content:
くわせもの〔食わせもの〕
〈名〉A counterfeit; a fake; a bogus:(人なら) a fraud; a sham; an impostor; a humbug

content.content: あれは食わせものだ
He is an impostor―a humbug.
日本に馴れない西洋人と見るとこんな食わせものを売りつける
They foist such fakes on foreigners new to the country.

content:
くわせる〔食わせる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=馬などに何を食わせる)to feed (a horse on or with some food―some food to a horse)

content.content: 僕の馬には麦と豆を食わせる
I feed my horse on corn and beans.
蚕桑の葉を食わせる
We feed the silkworm on mulberry-leaves―The silkworm is fed with mulberry-leaves.
油粕は牛に食わせる
Oil-cake is fed to cattle.

content: 2. (=ご馳走を食わせる)to treat (one to delicacies):(料理屋なら) to serve (good dishes―one with good dishes)

content.content: あの料理屋ではうまい物を食わせる
You are well served at that restaurant.
あの洋食屋ではうまいビフテキを食わせる
They serve good beefsteaks at that foreign restaurant.
今日は何を食わせようか
What shall I treat you to today?
彼らに腹いっぱい食わしてやりたい
I should like to let them eat their fill.

content: 3. (=家族などを養う)to feed, support, maintain, provide for (one's family)

content.content: 彼は大勢の子どもに食わしていかなけりゃならない
He has a large family to provide for.
百円の給料で五人の家族を食わしていくのは困難だ
It is hard to support a family of five on a salary of 100 yen a month.
彼は彼らを只で食わして着せておく
He feeds them and clothes them for nothing―He keeps them back and belly.

content:
4. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 一杯食わせる
to play a trick on one
一杯食わしてやった
I have played a trick on him―played him a trick―served him a trick.
まんまと一杯食わされた
I was nicely taken in―done brown.
剣突を食わせる
to give one a scolding
肘鉄砲を食わせる
to rebuff one―(女なら)―give one the mitten
さかねじを食わせる
to bite the biter―turn the tables on one
始めは飴を食わしておく
I give him line at first.

content:
くわだて〔企て〕
〈名〉
1. (=企図)a project; a plan; a design; a scheme; a plot; an intention; a proposition; contemplation:(=る) to project; to plan; to design; to scheme; to plot; to intend; to propose; to contemplate

content.content: 陰謀を企てる
to lay a plot―hatch a plot―plot―conspire―intrigue―machinate
謀叛を企てる
to plot a rebellion
暗殺を企てる
to plot one's death―plot for one's assassination―plot against one's life―conspire one's death―conspire against one's life―have designs upon one's life―make an attempt upon one's life
僕は洋行を企てている
I design going abroad―propose going abroad―intend to go abroad.
企てを実行する機会を得なかった
I had no opportunity of carrying my design into execution.
企ては画餅に帰した
The scheme has fallen through.
病気のためせっかくの企てが狂ってしまった
Illness has upset all my plans.
彼は始終なにかしら企てている
He is always scheming something or other.
学校を起こす企てがある
We have a new school in contemplation.
文部省には高等学校増設の企てがある
The Department of Education contemplates―has in contemplation―the establishment of more high schools.
これは誰の企てですか
With whom did the scheme originate?
知事の企てだ
The scheme originated with the governor.

content: 2. (=企業)an undertaking; an enterprise:(=る) to undertake (some work)

content.content: 事業を企てる
to undertake some work
これはちと冒険的な企てだ
This is a risky enterprise―a hazardous enterprise.
当ても無い企て
a wild-goose chase

content: 3. (=試み)an attempt:(=る) to attempt

content.content: 企ては効を奏した
The attempt proved effectual.
企ては効を奏さなかった
The attempt was ineffectual―The attempt was fruitless of results―The attempt was attended with no results.
彼の暗殺を企てた者があった
An attempt was made on his life.
情死を企てる
to attempt a double suicide
彼は絶望の極み自殺を企てた
Despair drove him to suicide.

content:
くわだておよばぬ〔企て及ばぬ〕
〈他動〉To be no match for (one)

content.content: 彼は英語ではとても我々の企て及ぶところにあらずだ
We are no match for him―not patch upon him―in English.
学問では彼に企て及ぶ者は無い
No one can compare with him―No one can hold a candle to him―in scholarship.

くわばらくわばら〔桑原桑原〕
〈間投詞〉Heaven protect me from thunder and lightning!

content:
くわわる〔加わる〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=加盟する)to join (a party); to join in (an undertaking); to participate in (a war); to take part in (a battle); to cast in one's lot with (a political party); to make one of (a party, etc.)

content.content: 僕も一行に加わった
I joined the party.
君も仲間に加わらないか
Won't you join the party?―make one (of the party)?
僕も事業に加わっている
I have joined in the enterprise―I have an interest in the enterprise.
会議に加わる
to take part in the conference―join in the debate
戦争に加わる
to participate in a war
米国が戦争に加わったのが同盟軍の勝利に与かって力ある

台風のおそれあり警戒す
The public is warned of an approaching storm.
暴風のおそれあり沿岸を警戒す
The coasts are warned of an approaching storm.
万一の警戒をしなければならぬ
We must guard against accidents―take precautions against accidents.
(あの男は悪い奴だから)彼を警戒せよ
You must guard against him―Be on your guard against him!―Beware of him!―(他動詞構文にすれば)―I warn you against him―I caution you against him.
流行病蔓延の兆あるによって警視庁においては警戒中なり
There are signs of the epidemic spreading, and the Metropolitan Police are on their guard against it.
(怠慢に失するは)警戒に失するに如かず
It is better to err on the side of caution.
(だまされないように)警戒すべしだ
You must look sharp about you.
女房を盗まれないように警戒せよ
Look sharp after your pretty wife!
病が警戒すべき兆候を呈した
The disease has developed alarm-symptoms.
警戒信号
a warning-signal―an alarm
警戒を解く
to withdraw a warning―The warning is withdrawn

content: 2. (=見張り)watch; lookout:(=する) to watch for (thieves); to look out for (a danger); to keep a good watch for, keep a sharp lookout for (pickpockets); to be on the watch for, on the lookout for, on the alert for, on the qui vive for (the enemy)

content.content: 盗賊を警戒せよ
Watch for thieves!―Look out for thieves!
すりを厳重に警戒せよ
Keep a good watch for pickpockets!―Keep a sharp lookout for pickpockets!
敵の襲撃を油断無く警戒せよ
Be on the watch for an attack!―Be on the lookout for an attack!―Be on the alert for an attack!
四方八方に目を配って敵を警戒している
They are on the alert for the enemy―on the qui vive for the enemy.
警戒厳重な城
a closely-watched castle―a closely-guarded castle

content:
けいかい〔軽快〕
〈形〉
1. (=気軽)light-hearted; gay; cheerful; buoyant

content.content: 軽快なふうをしている
He has a cheerful manner.
軽快な精神を持っている
He has a buoyant spirit.
軽快な男だ
He is a light-hearted fellow.

content: 2. (=身軽)light; agile; nimble; spry

content.content: 軽快な服装をしている
They are lightly clad.
軽快な挙動
agile movements―nimble movements
軽快敏活
alacrity
軽快敏活に立働く
to move with alacrity

content: 〈名〉(=病気の軽快)convalescence; recovery

content.content: 病人は次第に軽快に赴く
The invalid is convalescent―getting better―on the mending hand―on the mend.
病気は軽快に向かっている
His illness is progressing towards recovery―His illness has taken a favourable turn―taken a turn for the better.

content:
けいがい〔形骸〕
〈名〉A (soulless) body; a ruin (of what a person or thing once was)

content.content: 宮殿は昔日の形骸をとどむるのみ
The palace lies in ruins.

content:
けいがい〔謦咳〕
〈名〉Coughing; clearing the throat; talking and laughing

content.content: 謦咳に接する
to see a superior―make one's acquaintance
未だ氏の謦咳に接せず
I have not the honour of his acquaintance.

content:
けいかく〔圭角〕
〈名〉An angle; a corner

content.content: 人の圭角を取る
to bevel down the corners of a character
彼は山出しで圭角が取れない
He is an angular youth fresh from the mountains.
彼は圭角の無い人だ
He is a man of bland manners―of suave manners.

content:
けいかく〔計画〕
〈名〉
1. (=もくろみ)a plan; a project; a design; a scheme; a programme:(=する) to plan; to project; to design; to scheme; to programme

content.content: 計画を立てる
lay a plan―form a plan―form a scheme
将来の計画を立てている
I am forming plans for the future.
休暇中の計画を立てたか
Have you formed plans for the holidays?
計画を起こす
to start a project―set a project on foot―launch a scheme
学校設立の計画が起こっている
A project is on foot for starting a school.
計画を実行する
to carry out a plan―execute a plan―carry a design into execution
僕は洋行する計画であったが、実行する機会を得なかった
I was to have gone abroad, but had no opportunity to carry my design into execution.
計画通り実行する
to adhere to one's plan
計画を変更する
to depart from one's plan
事が計画通りに言った
The matter went off as it was planned.
計画をめぐらす
to revolve a scheme
せっかくの計画が画餅に帰した
The project has gone to the ground―The scheme has fallen through.
計画は漸く緒に就く
The project is fairly under way.
病気のために計画がすっかり狂ってしまった
My illness has upset all my plans.
彼は始終なにかしら計画に夢中になっている
He always has some project or other on the brain.
作戦計画
the plan of operations―the plan of campaign
財政計画
a financial programme
三年計画
a three year's programme
都市計画
city-planning

content: 2. (=画策)contemplation; calculation; proposition; intention:(=する) to contemplate; to have (something) in contemplation; to calculate; to propose; to intend; to purpose

content.content: 文部省では商業学校増設の計画がある
The Educational Department contemplates―has in contemplation―the establishment of more commercial schools.
高等学校増設は目下計画中
The establishment of more high schools is under contemplation―on the anvil.
僕の計画が齟齬{そご}した
My calculation has gone wrong.
計画は人に在り、成敗は天に在り
“Man proposes, God disposes.”

content:
けいがく〔計画〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: けいかく〔計画〕

けいかん〔掛冠〕
〈名〉Resignation:(=する) to resign (one's post)

content:
けいかん〔桂冠〕
〈名〉A laurel crown

content.content: 桂冠詩人
a poet laureate

content:
けいかん〔警官〕
〈名〉A police officer; a policeman:(集合的に言えば)the police

content.content: 警官の出張あり
The police were on the scene.

content:
けいかん〔鶏姦〕
〈名〉Sodomy; buggery; pederasty:(=する) to commit sodomy

content.content: 鶏姦者
a sodomite―a bugger

content:
けいがん〔慧眼〕
〈名〉A quick eye; a keen eye; a sharp eye; a piercing eye; a penetrating eye; penetration; discernment; perspicacity:(=の) quick-eyed; keen-eyed; sharp-eyed; lynx-eyed; penetrating; discerning; perspicacious

content.content: 慧眼にして機を逸せず
He has a quick eye for opportunities.
あのような慧眼の人に逢うてはどんな計略でも看破される
No design will avail with a man of his penetration.

けいがん〔鶏眼〕
〈名〉A corn; a clavus

けいかんせき〔鶏冠石〕
〈名〉Realgar; sandarac

content:
けいき〔刑期〕
〈名〉The term of penal servitude

content.content: 刑期が満つる
One's term expires―One serves time.
刑期が満ちて出獄した
At the expiration of his term, he was released from prison―He served out his time and was released.

content:
けいき〔景気〕
〈名〉
1. (=一般の景気)prosperity; activity

content.content: 景気の好い店だ
It is a prosperous house―a flourishing shop―a going concern.
店の景気はどうだい
How is the business doing?
店はたいそう景気が好い
The business is doing very well.
学校の景気は今月はどうだい
How is the school doing this month?
あまり景気が好くない
The school is not doing very well.
この品は景気が好い
This article is selling well.
芝居は景気が好い
The play is drawing well.
市中はすばらしい景気だ
The town exhibits immense activity.
景気をつける
to enliven a place―make things hum
会は楽隊で景気をつけた
The meeting was enlivened by a band.
一杯飲んで景気をつけようじゃないか
Let us liven up with a drink!
(露都では)敗報が来たためにお祭りの景気をそいだ
The new of defeat cast a gloom on the festival.

content: 2. (=個人の景気)prospects

content.content: 近頃景気はどうだい
How are your prospects?―How are you doing?―How is the world treating you?
景気が好い
My prospects are bright―My prospects are rosy.
景気が悪い
My prospects are dark―My prospects are gloomy.
近頃君はたいそう景気が好いそうだね
You are doing very well of late, I understand.

content: 3. (=世間の景気)the times; things

content.content: 世間の景気はどうだい
How are the times?
世間の景気が好い
The times are good.
景気が悪い
The times are bad―The times are hard.
そんなに景気が悪いのか
Are things so very bad?
景気が悪いのもどん底に達すると直る
When things are at their worst, they will mend.

content: 4. (=商売の景気)business; trade; the market; the tone of the market

content.content: 商売の景気はどうだい
How is business?―How is trade?
商売の景気が好い
Business is brisk―Trade is active.
景気が悪い
Business is dull―Business is slack―Trade is languid―Trade is stagnant.
市場の景気が好くなかった
The tone of the market has improved.
生糸の景気が好い
The silk trade is showing activity.
その頃は欧州戦乱のために海運界の景気がばかに好かった
Owing to the European war, the shipping trade was extremely brisk at the time.
勝報が来たので市中はたいへんな景気だった
The news of victory threw the whole city into great activity.
商売はどこも景気が悪い
The commercial depression is universal.
株式界は殊に景気が悪い
The stock-market is especially inactive.
商売は少し景気づいてきた
Trade is looking up a little.
にわか景気
a boom―flush times
戦争景気
a war-boom

げいぎ〔芸妓〕
〈名〉(The literary name for) a singing girl; a geisha

content:
けいききゅう〔軽気球〕
〈名〉A balloon

content.content: 軽気球を飛揚する
to fly a balloon

content:
けいきづく〔景気付く〕
〈自動〉To become brisk; to show activity; to look up; to liven up

content.content: 商売が少し景気がついてきた
Trade is looking up a little.
場面が景気づいてきた
The scene is livening up.

けいきへい〔軽騎兵〕
〈名〉Light cavalry; light horse:(一人なら)a light cavalryman

content:
けいきゅう〔警急〕
〈名〉Alarm

content.content: 警急ラッパを吹く
to sound the alarm

content:
けいきょ〔軽挙〕
〈名〉Rashness; a rash action; a hasty action

content.content: 軽挙妄動を戒む
Beware of rash actions!―Guard against rash steps!―I warn you against rashness.

content:
けいきょう〔景況〕
〈名〉An outlook; prospects

content.content: 商業の景況はどうですか
How is business?
商業の景況はたいへん好い
Business offers a bright prospect.
市場の景況はどうですか
How is the market?
市場の景気が悪い
The market has a gloomy prospect.
株式の景況はどうですか
How is the stock-market?
株式界の景況は振わぬ
The stock-market is dull.
競漕会の景況はどうでしたか
How did the regatta go off?
非常な景況でした
It went off extremely well.

けいきょく〔荊棘〕
〈名〉The bramble; the briar; thorns

content:
けいきょぼうどう〔軽挙妄動〕
〈名〉Rashness; a rash action; a hasty action

content.content: 軽挙妄動を戒む
Beware of rash actions!―Guard against rash steps!―I warn you against rashness.

content:
けいきょもうどう〔軽挙妄動〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: けいきょぼうどう〔軽挙妄動〕

content:
けいきんこ〔軽禁錮〕
〈名〉Minor confinement

content.content: 軽禁錮六カ月に処せらる
He was sentenced to six month's minor confinement.

content:
けいく〔警句〕
〈名〉
1. (=奇警の句)a witty remark; a pithy saying; a wise saw; an epigram

content.content: 警句を吐く
to make witty remarks
彼はなかなか警句を吐く男だ
He is very witty.
英国の Abernethy という医者は警句の多い人であった
Dr. Abernethy was renowned for his pithy sayings.
彼は警句の多い文章を書く
He writes an epigrammatic style.

content: 2. (=格言)a proverb; an aphorism; an apothegm

content.content: 警句に富める文体だ
It is a sententious style.

けいぐ〔敬具〕
〈結句〉Yours respectfully; yours truly

content:
けいぐん〔鶏群〕
〈名〉A flock of fowls

content.content: 鶏群の一鶴
“a Triton among the minnows.”
彼は鶏群の一鶴だ
He stands a giant among his comrades―He stands alone among his contemporaries.

content:
けいけい〔烱々〕
〈形〉Piercing

content.content: 眼光烱々人を射る
He has piercing eyes.

げいげいいう〔ゲイゲイ言う〕
〈自動〉(=吐きそうにゲイゲイ言う)To retch; to keck

content:
けいけいに〔軽々に〕
〈副〉Lightly; carelessly; easily

content.content: 事軽々に看過すべからず
The matter is not to be lightly passed over.
軽々に決すべき問題に非ず
The question is not to be lightly disposed of.
軽々に事を処す
to deal with a matter carelessly―trifle with a matter
彼は軽々に人の言うことを信ずる
He is easy of belief―credulous.
軽々に人の言うことを信ぜぬ
He is hard of belief―incredulous.

content:
けいけん〔敬虔〕
〈形〉Devout; pious; reverent; reverential

content.content: 彼は敬虔な仏教信者だ
He is a devout Buddhist―a pious Buddhist.
彼は神に対して敬虔の念が深い
He deeply reveres God.
敬虔な態度をとる
to assume a reverential attitude
皆な敬虔な態度で聴いている
They listen reverently.

content:
けいけん〔経験〕
〈名〉
1. Experience:(=する) to experience; to find

content.content: 知識の基礎は経験なり
Knowledge rests on experience.
彼は経験に富んでいる
He is rich in experience.
経験が広い
He has wide experience.
経験が狭い、経験に乏しい
He lacks experience―He is wanting in experience.
彼は授業の経験があるか
Has he any experience in teaching?
英語教授の経験がある
He has experience in teaching English―He is experienced in teaching English.
支那の学生を扱った経験もある
He has experience with Chinese students.
経験を積む
to gain experience
彼は経験が積んでいる
He has much experience―He is experienced.
経験家だ
He is an experienced man―a man of experience.
失敗が好い経験になった
I have gained good experience through my failure.
経験によって学ぶ
to learn by experience―profit by experience
経験は辛い思いをして得るものだ
Experience is dearly bought.
辛い経験をして学ぶ
to learn to one's sorrow―find to one's cost
借金の味は辛い経験をして知っている
I know to my cost what it is to be in debt.
多年の経験によって知っている
I know it by years of experience.
実地経験
practical experience
実地経験をする
to go through practical experience
僕は実地経験したことを言うのだ
I speak from experience.
経験談をする
to relate one's experience
艱難辛苦を経験する
to experience hardships―undergo hardships―go through hardships―see hardships
若いときは種々の経験をしておくものだ
A young man should go through various experience.
僕の経験したところでは支那人は日本人よりも語学がよい
So far as my experience goes, Chinese make better linguists than Japanese.
僕の経験によると女子は男子より語学がよい
In my experience, girls make better linguists than boys―I find that girls make better linguists than boys.
教材はこれを児童の経験範囲に採るを要す
The teaching matter must be chosen within the children's range of experience.
経験学派
the empiric school
経験哲学
the empirical philosophy
経験論
empiricism
経験論者
an empiricist

content:
けいげん〔軽減〕
〈名〉Reduction; mitigation; commutation:(=する) to reduce; to mitigate; to commute; to lighten

content.content: 刑を軽減する
to reduce the punishment―mitigate the punishment―commute the penalty
負担を軽減する
to lighten the burden
税を軽減する
to lighten the taxes

content:
けいこ〔稽古〕
〈名〉School; study; practice; training; lessons:(=する) to go to school; to study (English); to practise (swimming); to learn (how to swim); to take lessons in (jujutsu); to be trained in (jujutsu, etc.)

content.content: 稽古が始まったか
Has school begun?
稽古は八時に始まる
School begins at eight.
稽古はもう始まっている
School is going on.
明日は稽古が無い
There is no school tomorrow.
生徒は稽古中
The boys are at school.
この新芸は特別で大家でも稽古しなければならぬ
The new art has points that a master must go to school to learn.
英語を稽古する
to learn English―study English
誰について英語を稽古したか
Under whom did you study English?―(通例は)―Who taught you English?
英国人について英語を稽古した
I studied English under an Englishman.
馬の稽古中
I am learning how to ride.
水泳の稽古をする
to learn how to swim―practise swimming―(師匠を取ってなら)―take lessons in swimming
剣術の稽古をする
to learn how to fence―practise fencing―take lessons in fencing
柔術の稽古をする
to practise jujutsu―take lessons in jujutsu
僕は柔術を三年稽古した
I had a three years' training in jujutsu.
弓術を稽古する
to practise archery―take lessons in archery
茶や花を稽古する
to take lessons in ceremonial tea and flower-arrangement
稽古のために英語を教えている
I teach English for practice.
そんなことではまだ稽古が足らない
You have not had enough practice.
稽古頭にする
to learn to shave on one's head―“A barber learns to shave by shaving fools.”
芝居の稽古
a rehearsal―(をする)―to rehearse a play

けいご〔敬語〕
〈名〉An honorific (word or expression)

けいご〔警語〕
〈名〉A witty saying; a pithy saying

けいご〔警護〕
〈名〉Guard; escort:(=する) to guard (the route); to escort (a carriage, etc.)

げいこ〔芸子〕
〈名〉(The Kyoto name for) a singing girl, a geisha

content:
けいこう〔傾向〕
〈名〉Tendency (to or toward perfection); trend (of events); drift (of things in general):(心の傾向)inclination (to good or evil); disposition (to do something); predisposition (to some virtue or vice); propensity (to some vice); aptitude (to error)

content.content: 傾向がある
to have a tendency to (some result)―tend to (some result)―be apt to (do something)―be inclined to (severity or leniency)―be disposed to (take offence)
物価は下落の傾向がある
The prices show a downward tendency―The prices are looking down.
文学は人を上品にする傾向がある
Literature has a tendency to refinement―tends to refine the mind.
万物は完全に達せんとする傾向がある
All things tend towards perfection.
日本人は民主的の傾向を表してきた
The Japanese have come to show a democratic tendency.
この子は嘘をつく傾向がある
The boy has a propensity to lying.
名判官は寛大に処分する傾向がある
Great judges are inclined to leniency.
世人はとかくこの誤りに陥る傾向がある
People are apt to fall into this error.
今の青年は学問を軽視する傾向がある
Young men nowadays are apt to―inclined to―undervalue learning.
青年は専門を急ぐ傾向がある
Young men are inclined to―disposed to―rush into profession.
世の傾向
the trend of events
輿論の傾向
the trend of public opinion
自然の傾向
a natural tendency

content:
けいこう〔径行〕
〈名〉Impulsiveness

content.content: 直情径行の人
an impulsive man

けいこう〔景仰〕
〈名〉Admiration of one's virtues

content:
けいこう〔経行〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: げっけい〔月経〕

content:
けいこう〔鶏口〕
〈名〉A hen's bill

content.content: むしろ鶏口となるも牛尾となるなかれ
“Better be the head of an ass than the tail of a horse.”

content:
けいごう〔契合〕
〈名〉Agreement; coincidence:(=する) to agree; to coincide

content.content: 契合法
method of agreement

content:
げいごう〔迎合〕
〈名〉Flattery; adulation:(=する) to flatter; to truckle to (the great)

content.content: 人の説を迎合する
to echo one's views

content:
けいこく〔傾国〕
〈名〉The ruin of a country

content.content: 傾国の美人
a woman of ruinous beauty

content:
けいこく〔経国〕
〈名〉Statesmanship

content.content: 彼は経国の才がある
He has a talent for statesmanship.
経国の士
a statesman
経国の術
statecraft

content:
けいこく〔警告〕
〈名〉Warning; admonition; caution:(=する) to warn (one of danger); to admonish (one of one's duty); to warn, caution (one against error, etc.)

content.content: 危険を警告す
I warn you of danger.
彼に本分を忘れぬように警告した
I admonished him of his duty.
先生が生徒に落第せぬように警告した
The teacher warned the students against―cautioned the students against―failure in the examination.
彼に過労をせぬように警告した
I warned him against overworking himself―cautioned him against overwork.
(後から苦情の出ないように)前もって警告しておく
I give you fair warning―give you due warning.

けいこく〔谿谷〕
〈名〉A glen; a dale

けいこつ〔軽忽〕
〈名〉Rashness; hastiness; precipitancy:(=なる) rash; hasty; precipitate:(=に) rashly; hastily; precipitately

content:
げいごと〔芸事〕

to revolve a scheme―contrive a scheme―devise a stratagem―concoct a plot―form a design―lay a plan

to get hurt―hurt oneself―injure oneself―be injured―sustain an injury―(戦争でなら)―be wounded―receive a wound―sustain a wound
君はどうしてけがをしたか

to go harmless―get off without a scratch―escape with a whole skin―escape with life and limb―save one's skin―save one's hide

content:
けがす〔穢す〕
〈他動〉
1. To pollute (one's hands); to contaminate (food); to defile (a well); to stain, soil, sully, smutch (one's fame or reputation); to disgrace, dishonour (one's family or country); to profane, desecrate (a shrine)

content.content: 名をけがす
to sully one's name―soil one's reputation―disgrace oneself
名誉をけがす
to sully one's honour
家名をけがす
to disgrace one's family―dishonour one's family―bring dishonour on one's family―bring disgrace on one's family―cast a blot on one's escutcheon
家名をけがす不幸者
You are a disgrace to your family.
国家の体面をけがす
to disgrace one's country―dishonour one's country
そんなことをすると国家の体面をけがす
Such conduct will reflect on your country.
国家の体面をけがすな
Do not disgrace your country!―Do not be a disgrace to your country!
あれは国家の体面をけがす奴だ
He is a dishonour to his country.
そんなことをすると日本男子の体面をけがす
Such conduct will disgrace Japanese manhood―bring disgrace on Japanese manhood.
神聖をけがす
to profane―desecrate―violate the sanctity
神仏の神聖をけがす
to profane a temple―desecrate a shrine
議場の神聖をけがす
to violate the sanctity of the House
教室の神聖をけがすな
Do not violate the sanctity of the class-room.
これは家庭の神聖をけがすものである
This is a violation of the sanctity of the home.
神聖をけがす罪
profanation―desecration―sacrilege―blasphemy
僕も末席をけがしている
(協会なら)I have the honour of being a member―(学校なら)―I have the honour of being connected with the school.

content: 2. (=女をけがす)to dishonour, debauch, seduce, rape, violate, outrage (a woman)

content.content: 処女をけがす
to deflower a virgin
肌身をけがす
to dishonour a woman―(淫売をするの意味なら)―prostitute oneself
女が肌身をけがす

女が肌身をけがされる
A woman is dishonoured.
あの女は操をけがしている
She has lost her chastity―She has strayed from the path of virtue―She has a spot on her honour.

content:
けがにん〔怪我人〕
〈名〉An injured man:(集合的に言えば)the injured:(戦争のは)a wounded man:(集合的に言えば)the wounded

content.content: 馬が離れてけが人ができた
A horse got loose, and injured some people.
死人もけが人も無い

自動車が電車と衝突したが幸いけが人は無かった
